Title: BI Data Analyst
Description:
Rapid Finance has a dynamic and challenging opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our community. In this role, you’ll be responsible for design, development, and implementation of Data Warehouse and BI programs to provide insights that drive effective business decisions. The position ensures the necessary department data is available for use, either through the corporate data warehouse or by direct extraction from the source. If you want to help us harness the power of data to propel us into the future, we’d love to chat with you.

The ideal candidate will work with stakeholders including senior leadership, program management, project teams, and end users to identify requirements in support of business visualization objectives. Leverage data visualization tools and techniques to design, develop, and implement comprehensive automated solutions that support decision making and sector requirements. Maintain and enhance existing visualization solutions currently in use throughout the sector. The BI Analyst must have the ability to translate business requirements into logical data models and data requirements. You will be the data expert responsible for retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources, identifying key indicators and actionable insights, and effectively communicating the most important information to drive decisions.

A day in the life of the Business Intelligence Analyst may include:

Partner with business teams to consult, provide solution to implement data solutions, KPI’s, automated reporting/process solutions and data related improvements, streamline data migration by working closely with our data engineers to meet business needs.
Design, develop, and evaluate recurring and ad hoc reporting / dashboards in Power BI to drive and monitor the business and our products using best practices in data visualization and reporting tools.
Present recommendations to identify BI related workflows and sequencing events for automating and streamlining reports
Configure data mart schemas within the data warehouse per the specifications of the BI Development team
Identify source data in transactional systems
Lead analytics for the Marketing team by developing key performance indicators, analyzing and reporting out on the performance of key growth and marketing metrics to gauge trends, benchmarks, and performance of growth strategies, as well as derive value by analyzing customer data and identifying marketing opportunities.
Document the characteristics of the data, such as size, cardinality, completeness, and quality to ensure that product delivery meets requirements.
Support Sales and Client Service by studying product usage patterns, proactively identifying customers who may be under-utilizing products or functionality, and identifying new customers.
Develop and deploy ETL scripts to extract data from source systems and populate data marts according to predefined specifications.
Synthesize current business intelligence or trend data to support recommendations for action
Analyze data on existing customer characteristics and campaign performance to enable continuous refinement of data-driven engagement marketing strategies.
Create visualizations, Dashboards and reports for requested projects
Perform queries to validate the accuracy and completeness of ETL scripts and BI applications
Develop optimization strategies to minimize data reload time
Monitor data quality, analytics and metrics results
Turn data into actionable insight

About You:

· B.A./B.S. from an accredited university in Mathematics, Marketing Analytics, Information Systems, Business Information Technology, Economics; Computer Science, Statistics or a similar quantitative related field. Master’s degree in these disciplines are preferred.

· 6+ years of professional data analysis experience and DW/BI projects

· You have strong knowledge of AI/Machine Learning, data architectures, statistical techniques, and statistical computer languages.

· Experience or education in banking deposits, loan instruments, accounting (general ledger systems), Marketing or MCIF (Marketing Information Customer file) systems experience or corporate finance is a plus




· Thorough understanding of the following specific tools/technologies – Tableau, SQL, Python, MS PowerBI, IC Databases, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, including the skills to query database and recognize performance opportunities of reports/queries

· Familiarity with Agile Development methodology and Kimball SDLC

· Self-motivated with the ability to quickly learn new technologies

· Strong written, presentation, and verbal communication skills (Technical Writing experience is a plus). Comfortable and experienced in one-on-one interviews and leading small meetings

· Strong analysis, communications, interpersonal skills, and project management skills are essential

· Problem Solver – Someone who makes recommendations by identifying the problem, collaborating with stakeholders and business process owners to solve complicated issues with sustainable processes and systems, with written documentation and follow up to test the implemented solution

· Highly Organized – Ideal candidate will become a subject matter expert on all corporate data and be able to provide information upon request.

Technical skills required:

Proven experience in ETL scripting and advanced knowledge of SQL, R, and Python
Experience in both E-R and dimensional data modeling
Experience with data visualization platform such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau or DAX.
Expertise in data mining, forecasting, simulation, and/or predictive modeling
Experience with database synchronization, incremental/periodic data reload processes, data cleansing, database audit logs and metadata management
Experience developing data marts for BI applications
Experience or knowledge of QlikView, Qlik Sense, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake Analytics, SSRS, SSIS and Power BI is a plus.

We invite you to learn more about our business, and join our conversation at @LifeAtRapid

Discover what a career with Rapid Finance can do for you. Visit us today at rapidfinance.com/careers.

Rapid Finance is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce.

Show more
HTML:
Rapid Finance has a dynamic and challenging opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our community. In this role, you’ll be responsible for design, development, and implementation of Data Warehouse and BI programs to provide insights that drive effective business decisions. The position ensures the necessary department data is available for use, either through the corporate data warehouse or by direct extraction from the source. If you want to help us harness the power of data to propel us into the future, we’d love to chat with you.

The ideal candidate will work with stakeholders including senior leadership, program management, project teams, and end users to identify requirements in support of business visualization objectives. Leverage data visualization tools and techniques to design, develop, and implement comprehensive automated solutions that support decision making and sector requirements. Maintain and enhance existing visualization solutions currently in use throughout the sector. The BI Analyst must have the ability to translate business requirements into logical data models and data requirements. You will be the data expert responsible for retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources, identifying key indicators and actionable insights, and effectively communicating the most important information to drive decisions.

A day in the life of the Business Intelligence Analyst may include:

  • Partner with business teams to consult, provide solution to implement data solutions, KPI’s, automated reporting/process solutions and data related improvements, streamline data migration by working closely with our data engineers to meet business needs.
  • Design, develop, and evaluate recurring and ad hoc reporting / dashboards in Power BI to drive and monitor the business and our products using best practices in data visualization and reporting tools.
  • Present recommendations to identify BI related workflows and sequencing events for automating and streamlining reports
  • Configure data mart schemas within the data warehouse per the specifications of the BI Development team
  • Identify source data in transactional systems
  • Lead analytics for the Marketing team by developing key performance indicators, analyzing and reporting out on the performance of key growth and marketing metrics to gauge trends, benchmarks, and performance of growth strategies, as well as derive value by analyzing customer data and identifying marketing opportunities.
  • Document the characteristics of the data, such as size, cardinality, completeness, and quality to ensure that product delivery meets requirements.
  • Support Sales and Client Service by studying product usage patterns, proactively identifying customers who may be under-utilizing products or functionality, and identifying new customers.
  • Develop and deploy ETL scripts to extract data from source systems and populate data marts according to predefined specifications.
  • Synthesize current business intelligence or trend data to support recommendations for action
  • Analyze data on existing customer characteristics and campaign performance to enable continuous refinement of data-driven engagement marketing strategies.
  • Create visualizations, Dashboards and reports for requested projects
  • Perform queries to validate the accuracy and completeness of ETL scripts and BI applications
  • Develop optimization strategies to minimize data reload time
  • Monitor data quality, analytics and metrics results
  • Turn data into actionable insight

About You:

· B.A./B.S. from an accredited university in Mathematics, Marketing Analytics, Information Systems, Business Information Technology, Economics; Computer Science, Statistics or a similar quantitative related field. Master’s degree in these disciplines are preferred.

· 6+ years of professional data analysis experience and DW/BI projects

· You have strong knowledge of AI/Machine Learning, data architectures, statistical techniques, and statistical computer languages.

· Experience or education in banking deposits, loan instruments, accounting (general ledger systems), Marketing or MCIF (Marketing Information Customer file) systems experience or corporate finance is a plus


· Thorough understanding of the following specific tools/technologies – Tableau, SQL, Python, MS PowerBI, IC Databases, Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, including the skills to query database and recognize performance opportunities of reports/queries

· Familiarity with Agile Development methodology and Kimball SDLC

· Self-motivated with the ability to quickly learn new technologies

· Strong written, presentation, and verbal communication skills (Technical Writing experience is a plus). Comfortable and experienced in one-on-one interviews and leading small meetings

· Strong analysis, communications, interpersonal skills, and project management skills are essential

· Problem Solver – Someone who makes recommendations by identifying the problem, collaborating with stakeholders and business process owners to solve complicated issues with sustainable processes and systems, with written documentation and follow up to test the implemented solution

· Highly Organized – Ideal candidate will become a subject matter expert on all corporate data and be able to provide information upon request.

Technical skills required:

  • Proven experience in ETL scripting and advanced knowledge of SQL, R, and Python
  • Experience in both E-R and dimensional data modeling
  • Experience with data visualization platform such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau or DAX.
  • Expertise in data mining, forecasting, simulation, and/or predictive modeling
  • Experience with database synchronization, incremental/periodic data reload processes, data cleansing, database audit logs and metadata management
  • Experience developing data marts for BI applications
  • Experience or knowledge of QlikView, Qlik Sense, Azure Databricks, Azure Data Factory, Data Lake Analytics, SSRS, SSIS and Power BI is a plus.

We invite you to learn more about our business, and join our conversation at @LifeAtRapid

Discover what a career with Rapid Finance can do for you. Visit us today at rapidfinance.com/careers.

Rapid Finance is an equal opportunity employer and committed to a diverse workforce.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Duration: Long Term Contract to hire

Location: Greenwood Village, CO (Hybrid 4 days onsite/1 day remote)

Pay: $60-$65/hr




Our fortune 75 MSO client is in need of a data analyst to enable data-driven decision making and in-time health monitoring of brand new WiFi products by building and deploying product and feature specific analytics capabilities. You will support product teams with the complex design, development and implementation of automated reporting and dashboards. You will have the opportunity to build complex ad hoc reports and analytics. The end result will be robust analytics for measuring product health, usage and customer value.




QUALIFICATIONS

Design, develop, and implement complex reports and analytics
Very Strong SQL
Be able to write and do code reviews
Tableau experience preferred, some visualization required (Power BI, SSRS, etc.
Strong communication and collaboration
Ability to help others when needed instead of just delegating tasks
Nice to have:
Linux
Shell
Git
Hive/Hadoop




RESPONSIBILITIES/DAY TO DAY

Expertly use analytical tools to provide insight and make recommendations
Interact with various stakeholders to understand their business needs, communicate project status and develop relationships to ensure satisfaction
Provide ad-hoc analysis to address specific business questions from stakeholder groups
Perform code reviews with other developers
Collaborate with other members of the team




TEAM INFORMATION

This team is focused on analytics across a product portfolio dedicated to network management for devices connected to home WiFi. They are growing to support additional efforts on these product enhancements.




BENEFITS OF WORKING WITH BROOKSOURCE:

· Previous experience working with this client and placing both permanent employees and contractors.

· Direct communication with the hiring manager, which allows us to have a clear understanding of the timeline and move candidates through the interview process faster.

· Dedication to keep an open line of communication and provide full transparency.




Eight Eleven Group (Brooksource) provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Skylight is a technology startup based out of Los Angeles and San Francisco. Our mission is to make technology that brings families together. Our founders are former venture capitalists and serial entrepreneurs, who have scaled this business to $100M+ in annual revenue while being completely bootstrapped. We think often about the thousands of smiles we are able to put on our customers' faces each day, and it fills our hearts with purpose. That's why we have been working hard to expand our team and invent, so that we can continue to bring the magic of Skylight to millions of loved ones throughout the world.

We are ready to hire our first Product Data Analyst to lead our center of excellence for data analytics. This role will enable product, engineering, customer service, marketing, and executive teams by providing insightful data analysis, regular reporting, and self-service tools.

Responsibilities:


Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with various teams to identify data needs and methodologies
Project Management: Lead data projects independently, ensuring timely delivery
Data Analysis: Collect, structure, and interpret complex data into actionable insights
Dashboard Development: Create and maintain dashboards to communicate performance metrics
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models to support business functions
Tool Utilization: Use tools like Snowflake, dbt, Fivetran, and Metabase for data management and analysis


Continuous Improvement: Automate processes and optimize data delivery.

Requirements


Experience: 3+ years in a data analyst role; 2+ years with large datasets and enterprise data warehouse solutions
Technical Skills: Expert in SQL and familiarity with data tools like Snowflake, dbt, and Metabase
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills
Project Management: Proven project management skills with a focus on autonomy
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment



Benefits

Our competitive compensation package includes:


Competitive Salary + Equity Package
401K matching
Wellness, learning, and home-office budgets
Health, Dental & Vision Medical Plans
Tremendous autonomy to set the direction of your work
Unlimited PTO
Company holidays on the first Friday of every month (Except November & December)


Equal opportunity employer

Skylight is committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you're the best person for the job, we want you on board!

For Colorado-based candidates, the range being offered for this role is $120K-140K based on experience and for California-based candidates, the range being offered for this role is $120K-140K based on experience. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of this law.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role: Data Analyst

Location: Austin, TX (Hybrid)

Type: Contract - W2

Must Have: Python, Tableau, SQL, Spark Data Pipeline, Anti Money Laundering or Fraud Detection

Experience: 5+ Years

About the Role:

We are seeking hands-on professionals with a strong understanding of data and the ability to build dashboards using Tableau, SQL, and Python. Experience in an enterprise-level Retail/eCommerce domain is a must.

Requirements:

Data Visualization: Expertise in Tableau for creating interactive and insightful dashboards.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and Python for data querying, manipulation, and analysis.
Experience: 4-9 years in a similar analytics role, with a proven track record of delivering impactful insights.
Retail/eCommerce Domain: Must have experience in an enterprise-level Retail or eCommerce environment.
Python Proficiency: Strong capabilities in Python for data analysis, scripting, and automation.
Additional Skills: Experience with PySpark is a plus, though not required.
Communication: Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Title: SC2 Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: SC2 Data Analyst

FLSA Status: Exempt

Reports to SC2 Implementation Manager

 

Background:

Chicago CRED is a mission driven organization working to achieve transformational reduction in violence in Chicago. CRED does its work by offering direct services to those who are at the highest risk of violence, advocating for policy reform to increase public investment into community violence interventions, and promoting cross-sector coordination to achieve maximum impact.




Scaling Community Violence Intervention for a Safer Chicago, or SC2, is a growing

community of donors and anti-violence practitioners committed to working together to

advance one of the most promising near-term impact approaches, community

violence intervention (CVI). Their goal is fully resourced, locally-led, at-scale CVI

efforts in the 20 communities with the highest levels of gun violence.

At this early stage, SC2 is a strategy of the Partnership for Safe and Peaceful

Communities (PSPC), a coalition of more than 50 foundations and other philanthropic

entities. It also is a commitment of the Civic Committee of the Commercial Club of

Chicago, the city’s premier business-led organization concerned with the strength,

vitality, and growth of the city and the region. SC2 is supported Chicago CRED and Metropolitan Peace Initiative, the SC2 Implementation Partner. Representatives of these

latter organizations will engage with counterparts in the most-effected communities to

gauge interest and readiness to work at greater scale and share information about

effective tools and practices.




The goal is to grow SC2 to include, at “one table,” all the private, philanthropic,

community, and public leaders and funders, CVI practitioners, and other community-

based organizations needed to support, participate in, and sustain a shared plan to

significantly reduce gun violence in the 20 communities.




Department Function

The data analyst will be responsible to work in collaboration with all SC2 communities to help with technical assistance and day to day data responsibilities. This position will work closely with the SC2 Project Manager and will be responsible for cleaning data coming in from various sources (Salesforce, Apricot, RedCap, Evolve, NeonOne etc) to be able to curate a report that can align and will feed into a data warehouse. Chicago CRED is seeking a Data analyst to help work across a broad spectrum of stakeholders, build capacity for organizations in our neighborhoods and to create a data platform for ease of use and accessibility by partners.

 

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

·      Apply critical thinking and objective analysis to data sets, identify data trends, highlight anomalies.

Document data field dictionary/business glossary of Apricot objects and fields used by SC2 programs
Coordinate the migration of data into Apricot from third-party systems
Conduct analyses on raw data metrics being collected for specific dashboarding purposes and utilizing visualization tools to build reports for agencies
Develop and update SC2 dashboards
Data analysis and report writing for SC2-wide reporting
Assist with data clean up tasks such as duplicates and cleaning for warehouse accessibility
Assist in managing projects for Apricot optimization and updates
Assist in user access management with the timely addition and removal of users
Participate in and contribute to SC2 and data transformation committees and projects
Other case management system and data management duties as assigned

·      Manage short and long-term data projects including gathering requirements, developing project timelines, selecting appropriate tools for data cleansing, analysis, and visualization.

·      Create reports in the database to share updates with the hubs as well as reporting back to funders (as applicable)

·      Documentation, evaluation, and reporting of current data collection items and provide suggestions for improvement.

·      Provide SC2 organizations with technical assistance and evaluation oversight.

·      Work in conjunction with SC2 Project Manager to assess potential sites’ current level of documentation and potential areas for growth.

·      Collect and analyze crime and violence data from a range of public and private sources including the City of Chicago Violence Reduction Dashboard, City of Chicago Data Portal, Salesforce, external violence prevention organizations, etc.

·      Develops annual goals and plans for agency Outcome and Evaluation responsibilities. Make recommendations for Partnership strategic planning regarding evaluation and outcomes.




Experience and Qualifications

·     Experience using statistical computer languages (R, SQL, etc) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.

·     Experience working with data security measures and architecture.

·     Experience using visualization tools such as Adobe Indesign, Tableau, and/or Power BI

·     Experience with mapping software (ArcGIS, QGIS etc)

·     Strong communication skills and ability to present to various stakeholders of varied technical backgrounds.

·     Experience in data monitoring, cleaning, and analysis for varying audiences.

·     Experience using different data platforms such as Salesforce, Apricot, etc

·     Experience using data to support and/or measure impact of social service programs.

 

Educational Requirements

·     Masters Degree required




Location

This position will be based in Chicago’s West Side, South Side, etc. with local travel to site locations.




Physical Requirements and Working Environment

·     Ability to sit or stand for extended periods of time.

·     Ability to work with a computer for extended periods of time-up to 70%.




This position primarily works a hybrid schedule Monday-Friday during business hours but may require nights and weekends on some occasions. 

 

Compensation

$85,000-$95,000 (commensurate on experience)




Chicago CRED offers a competitive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, disability and 401K.




Chicago CRED, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer dedicated to the fair and equal treatment of all its employees without regard to age, gender, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, disability, political or union affiliation, maternity status, parental status, military status, or any other basis prohibited by law. Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.




The above job description is meant to describe the general nature and level of work being performed; it is not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required for the position.

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
About PrePass

PrePass® is North America's most utilized and technologically advanced weigh station bypass and toll payment platform. Proven PrePass technologies enable safe, qualified motor carriers to bypass inspection facilities at highway speeds, saving them time, fuel, and money while reducing emissions. As the only provider to offer bypass and tolling solutions, PrePass technology allows fleets to regain control of toll costs, eliminate toll violations, and automatically resolve max toll disputes. PrePass is the only preclearance system developed, owned, and operated in the United States of America as well as the American Trucking Associations' only Endorsed Corporate Partner. That's why more than 105,000 fleets subscribe over 750,000 commercial vehicles to PrePass services.

Position Description

We are seeking a BI Analyst to join our Business Intelligence Team. This position will report to the Senior Manager of Business Intelligence. You will be responsible for translating data into actionable insights for our company. The role collaborates with business and technical stakeholders to better understand goals and objectives. This is a Remote position, but does require occasional travel to our Downtown Phoenix office (across from the Footprint Center).

Key Responsibilities


Design, build, and deploy BI solutions as translated by business need.
Maintain, support and improve existing BI systems and data analytics platforms (e.g., PowerBI primarily)
Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting to identify areas of improvement in current operations.
Gather, analyze, and interpret data with accuracy and reliability to provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders that drive business decisions.
Create reports, dashboards, stories, and visualizations for requested projects that supports quantitative and qualitative data analysis
Collaborate with BI developers and data engineers to integrate systems and convert business requirements into technical specifications
Develop and update technical documentation.
Provide reporting solutions and respond to ad-hoc report requests across multiple business areas



Requirements


Qualifications


Required


Proven experience as a BI Analyst
Proficiency with data visualization tools, specifically PowerBI
Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g., Microsoft Power Platforms, Tableau, QlikView)
Basic SQL knowledge
BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field



Preferred


Advanced SQL skills; familiarity with No-SQL databases
Experience creating and maintaining ETL pipelines and automation
Understanding of data lake architecture and design principles
Familiarity with DevOps CI/CD implementation methodologies
Exceptional collaborative abilities, with a talent for navigating fluid environments and embracing change



Benefits


How We Will Take Care of You


Robust benefit package that includes medical, dental, and vision that start on date of hire
Paid Time Off, to include vacation, sick, holidays, and floating holidays
401(k) plan with employer match
Company-funded "lifestyle account" upon date of hire for you to apply toward your physical and mental well-being (i.e., ski passes, retreats, gym memberships)
Tuition Reimbursement Program
Voluntary benefits, to include but not limited to Legal and Pet Discounts
Employee Assistance Program (available at no cost to you)
Company-sponsored and funded "Culture Team" that focuses on the Physical, Mental, and Professional well-being of employees
Community Give-Back initiatives
Culture that focuses on employee development initiatives
Show more

PrePass® is North America's most utilized and technologically advanced weigh station bypass and toll payment platform. Proven PrePass technologies enable safe, qualified motor carriers to bypass inspection facilities at highway speeds, saving them time, fuel, and money while reducing emissions. As the only provider to offer bypass and tolling solutions, PrePass technology allows fleets to regain control of toll costs, eliminate toll violations, and automatically resolve max toll disputes. PrePass is the only preclearance system developed, owned, and operated in the United States of America as well as the American Trucking Associations' only Endorsed Corporate Partner. That's why more than 105,000 fleets subscribe over 750,000 commercial vehicles to PrePass services.

Position Description

We are seeking a BI Analyst to join our Business Intelligence Team. This position will report to the Senior Manager of Business Intelligence. You will be responsible for translating data into actionable insights for our company. The role collaborates with business and technical stakeholders to better understand goals and objectives. This is a Remote position, but does require occasional travel to our Downtown Phoenix office (across from the Footprint Center).

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, build, and deploy BI solutions as translated by business need.
  • Maintain, support and improve existing BI systems and data analytics platforms (e.g., PowerBI primarily)
  • Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting to identify areas of improvement in current operations.
  • Gather, analyze, and interpret data with accuracy and reliability to provide insights and recommendations to stakeholders that drive business decisions.
  • Create reports, dashboards, stories, and visualizations for requested projects that supports quantitative and qualitative data analysis
  • Collaborate with BI developers and data engineers to integrate systems and convert business requirements into technical specifications
  • Develop and update technical documentation.
  • Provide reporting solutions and respond to ad-hoc report requests across multiple business areas


Requirements


Qualifications


Required

  • Proven experience as a BI Analyst
  • Proficiency with data visualization tools, specifically PowerBI
  • Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g., Microsoft Power Platforms, Tableau, QlikView)
  • Basic SQL knowledge
  • BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or a relevant field


Preferred

  • Advanced SQL skills; familiarity with No-SQL databases
  • Experience creating and maintaining ETL pipelines and automation
  • Understanding of data lake architecture and design principles
  • Familiarity with DevOps CI/CD implementation methodologies
  • Exceptional collaborative abilities, with a talent for navigating fluid environments and embracing change


Benefits


How We Will Take Care of You

  • Robust benefit package that includes medical, dental, and vision that start on date of hire
  • Paid Time Off, to include vacation, sick, holidays, and floating holidays
  • 401(k) plan with employer match
  • Company-funded "lifestyle account" upon date of hire for you to apply toward your physical and mental well-being (i.e., ski passes, retreats, gym memberships)
  • Tuition Reimbursement Program
  • Voluntary benefits, to include but not limited to Legal and Pet Discounts
  • Employee Assistance Program (available at no cost to you)
  • Company-sponsored and funded "Culture Team" that focuses on the Physical, Mental, and Professional well-being of employees
  • Community Give-Back initiatives
  • Culture that focuses on employee development initiatives

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities


Develop, test, and maintain scalable web applications and APIs.
Write reusable, testable, and efficient code.
Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
Implement security and data protection solutions.
Participate in code reviews and contribute to technical discussions.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
Proven experience as a Python Developer.
Strong knowledge of Python frameworks such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI.
Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
Understanding of databases (SQL, NoSQL) and ORM.
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team environment.


Preferred Skills


Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
Understanding of RESTful API design principles.
Familiarity with version control systems (Git).

Responsibilities

  • Develop, test, and maintain scalable web applications and APIs.
  • Write reusable, testable, and efficient code.
  • Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
  • Implement security and data protection solutions.
  • Participate in code reviews and contribute to technical discussions.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
  • Proven experience as a Python Developer.
  • Strong knowledge of Python frameworks such as Django, Flask, or FastAPI.
  • Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
  • Understanding of databases (SQL, NoSQL) and ORM.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a team environment.

  • Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Knowledge of containerization and orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes).
  • Understanding of RESTful API design principles.
  • Familiarity with version control systems (Git).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Material Bank is a fast-paced, high-growth technology company and created the world's largest material marketplace for the Architecture and Design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to start and manage a design project. Learn more about us at www.materialbank.com or see below.

--

Are you passionate about shaping the future of data ecosystems? We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to be at the forefront of innovation, driving the architecture of our cutting-edge data platform. At Material Bank, you'll play a pivotal role in building a modern data infrastructure utilizing advanced technologies like real-time data streams and machine learning-powered insights.

In this role, you'll integrate various data initiatives into a unified schema, establishing a single source of truth across the organization. Your expertise will be critical in defining universal schemas, rationalizing domain data and structures, and empowering our team to make data-driven decisions. This is a rare opportunity to contribute to both B2B and B2C products, impacting high-profile projects that will shape the future of Material Bank.

What you’ll do:


Perform comprehensive data analysis to assess data quality and derive meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain data dictionaries, ensuring all team members have a clear understanding of data definitions and structures.
Prepare and present detailed reports to the executive team, highlighting trends, patterns, and predictions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data issues, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Participate in efforts to rationalize domain data and data structures to support business objectives.
Utilize various tools and platforms such as SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and Metabase for data analysis and visualization.
Support in the integration of data streams between Commerce Tools and Salesforce OMS using Kafka streams.
Support the development and implementation of the data catalog, tracking schema changes, data lineage, and metadata tagging.
Monitor and alert for data issues, ensuring proactive identification and resolution.



What you’ll bring:


3+ Years of Experience
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights
Proficiency in SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and other relevant data analysis tools
Experience with data visualization
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment



What you’ll get from us:


Our people: If you thrive in an inclusive, innovative, and fast-paced organization, look no further! You will get to work alongside some of the brightest minds - Join a genuinely fun and supportive workplace where we keep our employees consistently engaged through internal communication and corporate events
Relaxation and Celebrations: Generous PTO, Sick Days, Paid National Holidays, and even more (ask us about this when we connect).
Health Benefits: We contribute to your medical, dental, vision and short-term/long-term disability plans and have a strong employee assistance program.
Plan for your Retirement: 401(k) eligible after your first 90 day's employed!
Giving Back: We sponsor multiple events throughout the year to help out our communities. You will receive time off to give back as well.
Growth: We’ll help you take your career to the next level. We want you to be creative and take initiative which will allow you to grow and create within the company. Most importantly, be the best at what matters!
Flexible Work Schedules: With business units and employees across the globe, Material Technologies has embraced a hybrid  working model allowing department leaders to decide on the best approach for their respective teams, whether that be remote, in person, or a little of both.



About Material Bank

Material Bank is the world’s largest material marketplace for the architecture and design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to search and sample materials. Material Bank connects design professionals to hundreds of manufacturers through facilitating brand discovery, rep engagement, and material sampling.

Material Bank has transformed the way an entire industry discovers and samples materials. By removing the friction that exists in the process, we drive business between architects and designers (members) and our Brand Partners (clients).

Our powerful material database and proprietary robotic distribution facility allow members to order samples until midnight (ET) to be delivered free of charge anywhere in the US, in one box, by 10:30 AM the next morning.

Connect with us and discover your career at Material Bank.

--

Material Bank is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or other status protected under any applicable federal, state or local law.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
FMF / IMET Data Analyst

Qualifications:

This position is supporting the United States Department of Defense. US Citizenship is required to be considered for this position.
Department of Defense Active Security Clearance Required.
At least two years experience working on budget and fiscal processes for large-scale programs, preferably with the Department of State, Department of Defense, or a similar agency.
Some knowledge or understanding of international security cooperation and assistance practices is preferred.
Experience working in a DOS, DOD, or similar environment with financial data management and visualization is strongly preferred.
At least 2 years experience in data extraction and presentation using any combination of Oracle DB and tools, MS Access, Advanced Excel, MS SQL Management Studio, Tableau, R Language, or Power BI
At least 1 year of experience automating manual data extraction and reporting processes using scripting languages, database tools, or macros
At least 2 years experience in budget and financial management with Microsoft Excel.
Experience providing timely narrative and data-driven responses to requests for information or reporting
requests.
Strong oral and written communication skills with experience presenting complex information.
Knowledge of U.S. government security assistance or security cooperation programs is strongly desirable.

Responsibilities:

Work in Foreign Military Financing (FMF)/International Military Education and Training (IMET). Successful candidates will have proven abilities to assess current data management processes used by the organization and design and implement robust automated solutions that account for visualizations, reports, and validation.
Support program officers in the budgeting and execution process of the office's multibillion-dollar accounts, including general accounting, data management and validation, reconciliation, and efficient reporting from the data management systems in use.
Used and updated budget and financial data queries and dashboard views in systems such as Oracle, MS Access, Tableau, and MS Power BI.
Draft, execute, and track the funding approval process for over $6 billion in security assistance programming annually.
Provide research, data collection, analysis, and reporting of country programs using current data management systems and data UI tools.
Provide budget formulation and analysis support for all office programs.
Perform analytical, forecasting, and interpretive functions
for the management and control of budgetary and financial resources, including tracking current and prior-year funds.
Perform studies and audits on the control, allocation, and allotment of funds, assuring that allocations and allotments are in accordance with pertinent laws.
Make recommendations to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of financial controls using automated data management technology.
Assist in solution implementations.

Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
En el área de Datos de Mutua Madrileña queremos incorporar un Business Data Analyst para la vertical de Auditoría Finanzas y Riesgos.




Como Business Data Analyst trabajarás codo con codo con expertos de negocio para el desarrollo de aplicaciones y activos de explotación que permitan maximizar sus capacidades y obtener un retorno claro y conciso




Funciones del puesto:

Identificar oportunidades para transformar datos en palancas de Negocio, y proponer, elaborar y defender business case con un driver económico.
Trabajar con los clientes internos en entender sus necesidades para diseñar e implementar las aplicaciones, visualizaciones y activos que se requieran basadas en las necesidades del negocio
Implementar y evolucionar aplicaciones que permitan operar y tomar decisiones de negocio de forma innovadora.
Evolucionar las capacidades de visualización y análisis de datos asegurando un diseño atractivo para el usuario




Perfil solicitado:

Formación universitaria
Necesaria experiencia en el sector asegurador/financiero y/o ahorro e inversión.




Competencias necesarias:

Habilidad para entender e interpretar los requisitos de los usuarios y convertirlos en habilitadores para transformar el negocio
Conocimiento, proactividad y curiosidad en generar valor a partir del análisis de grandes volúmenes de información.
Experiencia en creación o diseños de cuadros de mando.

Se valorará:

Experiencia en gestión de proyectos orientados a negocio
Experiencia en entornos de trabajo dinámicos (Lean) con objetivos concretos y con foco en la iteración con usuarios.




Además de la cualificación profesional buscamos personas con valores basados en la relevancia, la autenticidad y la superación para lograr los objetivos marcados.




Mutua es #ElLugarqueTeMereces




Aceptando suscribirse a esta oferta consiente el tratamiento de sus datos personales conforme a los términos y condiciones establecidos en: https://www.grupomutua.es/proteccion-de-datos/

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
🚀 Ruolo: Junior Data Analyst




📍 Località: Roma, zona Eur




🕒 Tipo di Contratto: tempo indeterminato, full-time




✨ Su di noi

Benvenutə in SIAE, la Società Italiana degli Autori ed Editori! Siamo il faro per chi opera nel mondo della cultura e dello spettacolo e proteggiamo i diritti d’autore delle opere dei nostri associati e delle nostre associate, garantendo il giusto compenso per il loro talento. Unirsi a noi è una scelta volontaria che offre una tutela economica indispensabile per chi crea.




🎯 La tua sfida

Sei curiosə di sapere quali sono i dati con i quali lavoriamo per tutelare i diversi repertori artistici? Sei neolaureatə e hai voglia di fare la differenza mettendoti in gioco? La sfida offerta da SIAE è quella di trasformare grandi quantità di dati in informazioni utili al supporto delle decisioni strategiche delle diverse funzioni aziendali.




💼 Le Tue Responsabilità

Analisi di dati: raccoglierai e organizzerai dati per migliorarne la qualità e l’affidabilità e identificherai modelli, tendenze e insights

Creazione di dashboard e report: comunicherai i risultati dell’analisi in modo chiaro ed efficace ai diversi team aziendali

Sviluppo e implementazione di modelli predittivi: utilizzerai algoritmi di machine learning e tecniche statistiche

Collaborazione con team interfunzionali: contribuirai al cambiamento aziendale integrando soluzioni analitiche nei processi e identificando opportunità di miglioramento




🎓 Requisiti

Formazione: laurea in discipline STEM

Lingue: buona conoscenza della lingua inglese scritta e parlata

Linguaggi di programmazione: Python, R, SQL, Qlik, Power BI, Tableau

Pacchetto Office: conoscenza eccellente di Excel e Power Point

Soft Skills: Eccellenti capacità comunicative, problem-solving e team working




🌈 Nice to have:

Esperienza lavorativa minima/ stage come data analyst

Passione per l’analisi e la visualizzazione dei dati

Attitudine e coerenza con la cultura dell’apprendimento continuo e dell’innovazione

Forte engagement con il Purpose SIAE “dalla parte di chi crea”




💰 Cosa Offriamo

Contributo Welfare Aziendale

Buoni Pasto da €6,5 al giorno

Smart Working per 10 giorni al mese

Premio di Risultato

Assistenza Sanitaria UniSalute

Contributo Previdenza Complementare

Borse di Studio per i figli

Abbonamento Annuale alla piattaforma linguistica Speexx

Servizio di VideoVisite 7 giorni su 7, dalle 9:00 alle 23:00

Supporto Psicologico e Nutrizionale




🌟 I nostri valori

Trust: conquistiamo la fiducia con sincerità e rispetto

Innovation: guardiamo al futuro proteggendo la nostra identità

Execution: crediamo in ciò che facciamo con responsabilità e passione

Entrepreneurship: siamo intraprendenti e valorizziamo iniziative e intuizioni




🚀 Unisciti a Noi: valutiamo tutte le candidature ricevute coerentemente con la cultura inclusiva e i valori che ci contraddistinguono ogni giorno, volti a valorizzare la diversità nelle sue molteplici forme come fondamentale contributo per la crescita aziendale e collettiva.

Title: Analista de datos Junior
Description:
Somos una multinacional canadiense especializada en consultoría tecnológica, con presencia en 21 sectores en más de 400 ubicaciones en todo el mundo, proveemos servicios de consultoría de negocio y de TI integrales, escalables y sostenibles que están analizados globalmente y entregados localmente.




Estamos buscando un/a Analista de Datos (junior) para impulsar nuestro equipo y realizar un trabajo de calidad del dato y realización de modelos de control para un cliente estratégico dentro de un gran proyecto.




Habilidades y Competencias Técnicas:

•Experiencia con Power BI

•Experiencia con SQL

•Experiencia con Python

•Conocimientos en el sector seguros




Grupo CGI ofrece:




-Contratación indefinida

-Horario flexible.

-Proyectos estable de larga duración.

-Pertenecer a un equipo de trabajo altamente cualificado en una empresa joven en proceso de expansión.

-Trabajar en un ambiente de trabajo amigable, donde la estrecha relación con los managers y con RRHH facilita el espíritu emprendedor, el intercambio de ideas, la iniciativa y el desarrollo de las personas.

-Formación en distintas tecnologías.

-Desarrollo profesional.




Si tienes capacidad de trabajo y ganas de seguir aprendiendo en una empresa dinámica y en constante crecimiento... ¡Esta es tu oportunidad!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

We are recruiting for our Marketing Analytics team. The Junior Data Analyst position is an important role within the department, reporting into the Targeting Analytics Manager.

What you'll be doing?

You will deliver analytical projects; this will involve analysing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data and communicating your findings to different stakeholders within Experian.

Working with your team, you will blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical or spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analysing data.

Qualifications

What you'll bring?

Skills

We're after a team player who has a desire to deliver analysis projects to budgeted time, with accuracy, using core analytical techniques and applications. Desire and determination to develop your skills. Therefore, you'll bring:


Mathematical competency;
Geospatial/GIS expertise;
Data analysis and interpretation.


The following additional skills would be advantageous but not essential:


Regression Modelling;
Segmentation;
Machine Learning;
Location analysis.


It Would Be Great If You Have Previous Experience Of Data Analysis And Interpretation And An Understanding Of Any Programming Languages And Applications Such As


R;
Python;
SAS;
Alteryx;
VBA;
SQL;
Tableau, MicroStrategy or PowerBI;
ArcGIS, MapIinfo or other GIS software.


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are working with an Irish organisation that are currently looking to hire a data analyst. They work in a hybrid working model, 3 days onsite and 2 days remotely, based in southwest Dublin. They can provide a good salary, bonus and benefits as well as opportunities for career progression.

Primary Duties




Support stakeholders throughout the business through Data Insights
Work with large datasets in order to produce clear patterns from the data
Look after all additional aspects of data management




Requirements




2 years + in Data Analytics
Experience working in visualisation
Good communication skills




On Offer




The client will provide a good salary of €45,000 (potentially a little higher) + 10% bonus
The opportunity to work in hybrid, 3 days onsite and 2 days remotely
Good opportunities for career progression




Apply now by clicking the “Apply Now” button. Even if the job isn't quite right but you are looking for something similar, please get in touch

Gain access to exclusive roles that are not advertised elsewhere
We’ll help manage your job hunt, strengthen your interview skills and tidy up your CV
We’ll provide you with an overview of the jobs market within your industry and help you tailor your jobs search

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Strong communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)


It Would Be Great If You Also Have


Knowledge of financial markets (options, futures, etc.)
Familiarity with financial products


If it seems like a match, don't wait! Apply now and show us what you've got 🔥

What we offer;

At LYNX, we value your growth and development; we'll provide you with a supportive work environment and opportunities for your professional development.


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience;
Pension scheme that is fully paid by LYNX;
Free lunch from our cook or lunch ticket, fresh juices & fruit;
Travel allowance;
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of € 2,000 per year;
Trips & activities with your colleagues;
Relaxed and informal working environment.


About Us

"LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join Marveltest as a Data Analyst! 




About Us: At Marveltest, we’re at the forefront of data-driven business solutions. Our mission is to help businesses unlock the power of their data to drive growth and efficiency. As we continue to expand, we’re looking for a talented and motivated Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. If you’re passionate about data and love turning numbers into actionable insights, we want to hear from you!We’re looking for a Medior Data Analyst to join our team and help our clients reach the next digital level. You’ll be working with our Data Analysts, Growth Marketers, Client Managers, and Data-driven Designers to build data related products and services such as Data Warehousing and Pixel Tracking TechnologyYour Role: As a Medior Data Analyst at Marveltest, you’ll be a key player in transforming complex data into valuable business insights. Your responsibilities will include:




Data Warehousing: Manage data warehouses, focusing on data quality and validity.
Tableau Workbooks: Create and update Tableau dashboards, implementing changes based on internal and external requests.
Analytical Structures: Collaborate on designing modular and reusable analysis structures in Tableau.
Ad hoc Analyses: Conduct tailored analyses to answer business questions from both internal and external stakeholders.
Client Communication: Work closely with internal teams and clients to understand their data requirements and provide insights through dashboards and analyses.
Documentation: Maintain organized records of your analyses, ensuring they are accessible for future reference.




Collaboration within the Data Team: You’ll work closely with:

Business Analyst: Fine-tune business analyses to meet client needs.
Data Science/Engineering: Ensure seamless data flow from BigQuery to Tableau, troubleshoot issues, and improve data structure and quality.




Required Skillset:

Python: Proficient in using Python for data analysis and automation.
Excel: Comfortable with Excel, particularly for data manipulation and reporting.
Tableau (Advanced): 1+ years of experience with Tableau or a similar data visualization tool.
SQL: Strong SQL skills, with experience navigating Google BigQuery or other cloud data warehouses.
Business Acumen: Ability to connect data insights with business objectives, making recommendations that drive value.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Data Simplification: Ability to explain complex analyses to non-data-savvy stakeholders.
Proactive Mindset: Eager to take initiative in a fast-paced startup environment.
Client Communication: Willingness to participate in client meetings and explain data insights clearly.




What do I get in return? 

Above market salary: we believe your superpowers should be well compensated.
A culture where growth, freedom, and innovation are key.
Working in an ambitious but close team: together we pull out all the stops when duty calls, but as it goes with superheroes, in real life we’re just a bunch of normal people who like to have a lot of fun together.
Help build the company: together we are always busy creating and testing new business frameworks, processes, and products.
The chance to be part of a fast-growing scale-up where you make a real impact on all clients.
The ability to work from our office in the center of Amsterdam, but also the flexibility to work from the comfort of your own home.
Bi-monthly team bonding events, weekly drinks, and daily get-togethers during (by Marveltest provided) lunch.
Your personal development is important! We have a personal budget for YOUR development.
An employee benefit to spend freely each month on a wide range of treats, powered by YourCampus.
26 paid holidays a year.
A MacBook Pro M-Chip laptop




Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for a new Data Analyst – Life Insurance. Join our leading life insurance company, where innovation meets tradition. We are on a mission to redefine the future of life insurance, using data to tailor and enhance our services for our clients. At Metropolitan Life, we believe in empowering our employees with the tools and culture they need to thrive and innovate.


As a Data Analyst you will dive deep into our data, using dedicated tools to extract actionable insights that will drive our strategic decisions and keep us at the forefront of the life insurance industry. Some of the key skills required for this role include, but are not limited to, a strong customer focus, the ability to think analytically, effectively, creatively to analyze data and use it to drive decision-driven actions.


Key Responsibilities:


Data Management: Utilize MySQL, Power BI and other internal platforms for complex data querying, manipulation, and analysis across multiple databases. Ensure data integrity and accuracy, perform corrections in all reports and analyses.

Insight Generation: Use Power BI and other internal platforms to create compelling visualizations and dashboards that communicate trends, patterns, and insights to non-technical stakeholders to drive commercial impact.

Business Acumen: Understanding business processes, objectives, and key performance indicators (KPI) to contextualize data analysis with the business context.

Strategic Support: Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytics support that guides decision-making and strategy development to improve customer experience and commercial impact.

Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in data analytics and visualization. Recommend and implement improvements to our data practices and tools.

Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills are necessary to explain technical concepts, present findings, and foster a collaborative environment where data insights and findings are shared and acted upon.

Time management: Efficiently managing time and priorities to meet project deadlines and deliver high-quality results.


Job requirements:


  • Bachelor’s degree in STEM, or a related field;
  • Proficient in SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Excel, CRM platforms;
  • Nice to have data base architecture knowledge;
  • Nice to have Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics knowledge;
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the insurance or financial services industry;
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for all levels of the company;
  • A team player who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


We value your work, by offering:


  • Friendly environment with multiple career development opportunities;
  • Inclusive and multicultural team where you can create impact with your innovative ideas and creative personality;
  • Various learning & development programs adapted to your needs and goals;
  • Benefits (flexible hours, meal tickets, private medical subscription, insurance policy, Bookster subscription, additional holidays based on seniority, annual performance bonus, holiday bonus, etc);
  • Excellent location – close to public transport stations (bus & subway) & hybrid way of working.


At Metropolitan Life, part of MetLife, Inc, one of the largest life insurance companies in the world, we’re leading the global transformation of an industry we’ve long defined. Named a Certified Great Place to Work, we are united in purpose, diverse in perspective, and dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our customers.


Great Place To Work® Certified in Romania


Metropolitan Life is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is Metropolitan’s Life policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, colour, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst Junior
Description:
Unlimitail is a joint venture between Carrefour Group and Publicis Group, intending to become the leader of the retail media market in Europe and Latin America. It combines the power of Carrefour Links' in-store and e-commerce assets and traffic with Publicis Citrus Ad and Epsilon's on-site and off-site retail media technologies. The goal of Unlimitail is to become the premier retail media player in Continental Europe and South America for both in-store and digital channels.




Missions

Within the Product team, your mission will be to participate in the development of Unlimitail’s analytics capabilities. Your environment will be millions of transactional data coming from major retailers on the market to analyze and improve the performance of online and offline marketing campaigns.




As we work with both retailers (providing media inventory) and brands (buying media inventory), you will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the retail media ecosystem.

You will work with different teams (Ad Operations, Marketing, Sales) in different countries and on a wide variety of topics:




- Perform e-commerce campaigns analysis to provide detailed insights

- Conduct end-to-end ad hoc analysis to help retailers best monetize their inventory

- Participate in the design and maintenance of databases, using SQL to store and manage data efficiently

- Work on automating data analysis and data visualization capabilities

- Work on Unlimitail’s customer lifetime value calculation capability

- Participate in the development of new, cutting-edge abilities to create the best




Requirements:

· Master's degree in Data Analysis, business analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.

· Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights through using strong SQL skills for querying and data extraction.

· Programming Languages: Python and SQL are mandatory. Any other is a plus

· Data Visualization: previous experience in creating interactive and insightful visualizations, using tools like Power BI or Looker is a big plus

· Knowledge of GCP or Azure environment is a plus

· Problem-solving: Adept at approaching analytical problems and proposing effective solutions.

· Good communication skills in English. Another language (Spanish, Portuguese) is a plus.

· Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively




Benefits:

· 2 days of WFH

· 90% reimbursement of public transportation fees

· Office located in central Paris (Chatelet)

· Swile card of 10€/working days

Within the Product team, your mission will be to participate in the development of Unlimitail’s analytics capabilities. Your environment will be millions of transactional data coming from major retailers on the market to analyze and improve the performance of online and offline marketing campaigns.


As we work with both retailers (providing media inventory) and brands (buying media inventory), you will have the opportunity to gain a deep understanding of the retail media ecosystem.

You will work with different teams (Ad Operations, Marketing, Sales) in different countries and on a wide variety of topics:


- Perform e-commerce campaigns analysis to provide detailed insights

- Conduct end-to-end ad hoc analysis to help retailers best monetize their inventory

- Participate in the design and maintenance of databases, using SQL to store and manage data efficiently

- Work on automating data analysis and data visualization capabilities

- Work on Unlimitail’s customer lifetime value calculation capability

- Participate in the development of new, cutting-edge abilities to create the best


Requirements:

· Master's degree in Data Analysis, business analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field.

· Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights through using strong SQL skills for querying and data extraction.

· Programming Languages: Python and SQL are mandatory. Any other is a plus

· Data Visualization: previous experience in creating interactive and insightful visualizations, using tools like Power BI or Looker is a big plus

· Knowledge of GCP or Azure environment is a plus

· Problem-solving: Adept at approaching analytical problems and proposing effective solutions.

· Good communication skills in English. Another language (Spanish, Portuguese) is a plus.

· Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively


Benefits:

· 2 days of WFH

· 90% reimbursement of public transportation fees

· Office located in central Paris (Chatelet)

· Swile card of 10€/working days

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

We are recruiting for a role within our Marketing Analytics team. The Associate Data Analyst is reporting into the Targeting Analytics Manager.

What you'll be doing?

You will deliver analytical projects; this will involve analyzing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data and communicating your findings to different stakeholders within Experian.

Working with your team, you will blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical or spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analysing data.

Qualifications

What you'll bring?

Skills

We're after a team player who has a desire to deliver analysis projects to budgeted time, with accuracy, using core analytical techniques and applications. Enthusiasm and determination to develop your skills. Therefore, you'll bring:


Mathematical competency;
Geospatial/GIS expertise;
Data analysis and interpretation.


The following additional skills would be advantageous but not essential:


Regression Modelling;
Segmentation;
Machine Learning;
Location analysis.


It Would Be Great If You Have Previous Experience Of Data Analysis And Interpretation And An Understanding Of Any Programming Languages And Applications Such As


R;
Python;
SAS;
Alteryx;
VBA;
SQL;
Tableau, MicroStrategy or PowerBI;
ArcGIS, MapIinfo or other GIS software.


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here
