Title: Data Analyst
Description:
⭐ 𝐓𝐮 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐞𝐭 𝐚̀ 𝐚𝐯𝐨𝐢𝐫 𝐮𝐧 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐬𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐜𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 ?




💥 𝐓𝐮 𝐬𝐨𝐮𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐞𝐧 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞 ?







Alors notre entreprise, 𝐂𝐫𝐞́𝐝𝐢𝐭 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, pourrait te correspondre !




𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 ? Nous fabriquons les outils informatiques des conseillers bancaires et de nos clients du réseau bancaire des Caisses Régionales du groupe Crédit Agricole.




𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞 ? Nous continuerons, 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐜 𝐭𝐨𝐢 𝐞𝐭 𝐧𝐨𝐬 𝟏𝟖𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, à « 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑟𝑒 𝑑𝑒 𝐶𝐴-𝑇𝑆, 𝑙'𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑢𝑟 𝐼𝑇 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒́𝑓𝑒́𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑒𝑛 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑒𝑠 𝑑𝑒 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒, 𝑑𝑒 𝑡𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒 𝑒𝑡 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑛𝑠𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑒́ 𝑠𝑜𝑐𝑖𝑒́𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒 » avec comme objectif commun : la satisfaction client.




Quelle est ta contribution en tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre DATA 🌟 ?




En tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre Data, tu seras accueilli.e comme un véritable moteur à notre efficacité collective, au même titre que tous les membres du Chapitre.




Intégrant une communauté dynamique et experte de plus de 30 collaborateurs, tu auras un impact direct et mesurable sur les services autour de la Data destinés à nos Pôles Produits IT et nos collaborateurs en Caisses régionales.




En tant que spécialiste du traitement de la donnée, tu seras amené à extraire et exploiter les données métiers exposées, les restituer sous forme de Tableaux de Bords et d’en mener des analyses en lien fort avec les métiers concernés. Tu chercheras constamment à faciliter la prise de décision des métiers via la data ; véritable levier de création de valeur métier.




𝐓𝐮 𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐥’𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐞́ :







🚀 Participer à des projets excitants en couvrant des cas d’usages Data variés :




Contribuer à la mise en œuvre de cas d’usages Data sur des domaines et des enjeux métiers variés




Collaborer en transverse avec différentes Squads et ainsi des acteurs multiples




Echanger et améliorer les pratiques de Fabrication avec les autres membres du Chapitre du site de Lyon mais aussi ceux des autres sites France




🔍 D’apporter ton expertise d’analyse de la donnée pour répondre à des besoins métiers à forts enjeux bancaires :




En collaborant étroitement avec les Business Analystes afin d’identifier les besoins Data du métier grâce à des ateliers d’affinage




En collectant et exploitant les données pour les restituer sous forme d’indicateurs ou de Tableaux de bord, et ainsi contribuer et conduire les analyses Data mises en lien avec les problématiques métiers




En présentant les résultats aux équipes métiers




En étant un véritable référent et ambassadeur de la Data sur des sujets transverses




En véhiculant auprès des métiers le cadre de gouvernance Data (Data Management, Data Privacy…) de l’entreprise, en portant les messages et expertises autour du Digital




En contribuant à l’évolution des pratiques du Chapitre dans une logique d’amélioration continue




💻 D’utiliser et d’améliorer au quotidien nos outils et nos process d’analyses :




Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord via Microstrategy (sur des activités BI)




Calcul d’indicateurs via script SQL sur environnement Teradata (sur des activités BI) et intégration dans des pipelines de restitution normées




Mise en œuvre du Tracking sur les parcours utilisateurs et Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord pour restituer les données aux métier (sur des activités Parcours Digitaux) - Logiciel et solutions analytiques : Tag Commander, Piano Analytics, Cosmo Survey




Conduite des analyses marketing sur la base du tracking déployé et force de proposition sur les possibles optimisations lors de ces analyses.




Ta vie au sein de notre Equipe :




✅ Un environnement de travail axé sur la qualité et l’intelligence collective.




🌟 L’opportunité de favoriser le quotidien de nos conseillers en agence et la satisfaction de nos 21 millions de clients à travers la France.




👪 Un accueil personnalisé assuré par tes collègues en complément du management et des référents RH pour vous aider à maximiser votre potentiel




🧠 Des sessions collaboratives de brainstorming et de résolution de problèmes pour favoriser l'innovation




💬 Un accès continu à la connaissance grâce à un catalogue très riche de formations en savoir-faire et en savoir-être, des accès aux salons, conférences et événements (Devoxx, DevFest, Vivatech, Salon de la data et de l’IA, ..) pour rester à la pointe des dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques




🌟 Participer activement aux activités "d’innovation" via des ateliers d’idéation technique et par la mise en place de nouvelles pratiques agiles.




🧠 Nourrir ta curiosité et ta soif d'apprentissage dans un environnement qui encourage la croissance professionnelle.







Découvrez le site de Lyon







𝐂𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐩𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐚 𝐯𝐢𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐟𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐞𝐭 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 :




Nous te proposons :




🚀 De participer à l’évolution de CA-TS en matière de performance, de technologie et de responsabilité sociétale : participation aux projets d’entreprise, développement de la fabrication responsable, contribution à la diminution de notre empreinte carbone.




👥De rejoindre CATECHS : LA communauté des techs de CA-TS. Et y retrouver des Techtalks, des sérious games, du Mob Programming, de la veille techno…




👨‍💻 De prendre part à des projets agiles complexes et innovants, de bout en bout : volumétrie clients importante, diversité technologique et métier, relation étroite avec tous nos clients (Conseillers bancaires en Caisses Régionales, clients du Crédit Agricole)




🏦 D’évoluer dans un environnement alliant modernité (espaces agiles et de créativité, télétravail) et prônant la Qualité de Vie au Travail (équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle, avantages parentalité, forfait mobilité durable)




👫 De faire partie d’une entreprise motrice sur la diversité et l’égalité (94/100 sur l’index égalité Femmes / Hommes qui évalue la politique en matière d’égalité salariale et promotion entre femmes et hommes.)




🌿 De rejoindre une entreprise labélisée numérique responsable qui participe aux enjeux de sobriété et d’inclusion numérique (par exemple l’écoconception et l’accessibilité numérique) qui sont au cœur de la fabrication




🧠 De continuer à développer tes compétences et connaissances, à être accompagné∙e ou accompagner à ton tour (formations, intégration, mentoring, mobilité interne, actions marque employeur)




⭐ De faire évoluer ta carrière professionnelle et t’investir durablement (mobilités interne et groupe).













𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜̧𝐚, 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 :




💻 D’être cadre au forfait en ayant de la flexibilité sur la gestion du temps de travail, tu pourras travailler à distance 2 jours par semaine.




🏖 De disposer, en moyenne chaque année, de 46 jours de congés, et un compte épargne temps pour vous reposer et faire ce que vous aimez chaque année.




👪 D’avoir la possibilité de recevoir un intéressement important en lien avec les résultats de CATS.




🚎🌿 D’avoir un remboursement à hauteur de 75% de tes transports en commun / une Prime mobilité verte de 500 euros par an.




💳 D’avoir accès à un restaurant d’entreprise, aux avantages bancaires et assurances du Groupe CA, un CSE compétitif ainsi que d’une excellente couverture santé pour prendre soin de vous et de votre famille.




💟 De participer au programme de l’arrondi sur salaire au bénéfice d’associations...







𝐀̀ 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐢 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 ?




- Un premier échange avec ta Talent acquisition Spécialiste Mélissa- 1h

- Un test technique + un second échange avec un ou une de nos expert.es - 1h

- Un dernier échange avec Marieke ta future Leader ! - 1h




« 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑐𝑒 𝑞𝑢𝑒 𝑙𝑒 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑛𝑒 𝑑𝑜𝑖𝑡 𝑝𝑙𝑢𝑠 𝑒̂𝑡𝑟𝑒 𝑢𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑒𝑛 𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑟𝑒𝑝𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑒, 𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑠, 𝐶𝑟𝑒́𝑑𝑖𝑡 𝐴𝑔𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑜𝑙𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒𝑠 𝑒𝑡 𝑆𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑖𝑐𝑒𝑠, 𝑎𝑣𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑜𝑢𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑡 𝑛𝑜𝑠 𝑚𝑒́𝑡𝑖𝑒𝑟𝑠 𝑎̀ 𝑡𝑜𝑢𝑠 𝑙𝑒𝑠 𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑠, 𝑠𝑎𝑛𝑠 𝑒𝑥𝑐𝑒𝑝𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛.»

HTML:
⭐ 𝐓𝐮 𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐜𝐡𝐞𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐫𝐨𝐮𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐮 𝐬𝐞𝐧𝐬 𝐚̀ 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥 𝐞𝐭 𝐚̀ 𝐚𝐯𝐨𝐢𝐫 𝐮𝐧 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐚𝐜𝐭 𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐬𝐮𝐫 𝐥𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐝𝐢𝐞𝐧 𝐝𝐞 𝐦𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐜𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐬 𝐛𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐚𝐢𝐫𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐧 𝐅𝐫𝐚𝐧𝐜𝐞 ?


💥 𝐓𝐮 𝐬𝐨𝐮𝐡𝐚𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐬 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐞𝐫 𝐝𝐚𝐧𝐬 𝐮𝐧 𝐞𝐧𝐯𝐢𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 𝐚𝐠𝐢𝐥𝐞, 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐟 𝐞𝐭 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐞𝐧 𝐞́𝐯𝐨𝐥𝐮𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞 ?



Alors notre entreprise, 𝐂𝐫𝐞́𝐝𝐢𝐭 𝐀𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐞 𝐓𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐒𝐞𝐫𝐯𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, pourrait te correspondre !


𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 ? Nous fabriquons les outils informatiques des conseillers bancaires et de nos clients du réseau bancaire des Caisses Régionales du groupe Crédit Agricole.


𝐐𝐮𝐞 𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐨𝐧𝐬-𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐞𝐧𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞 ? Nous continuerons, 𝐚𝐯𝐞𝐜 𝐭𝐨𝐢 𝐞𝐭 𝐧𝐨𝐬 𝟏𝟖𝟓𝟎 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐮𝐫𝐬 𝐞𝐭 𝐜𝐨𝐥𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐞𝐬, à « 𝑓𝑎𝑖𝑟𝑒 𝑑𝑒 𝐶𝐴-𝑇𝑆, 𝑙'𝑎𝑐𝑡𝑒𝑢𝑟 𝐼𝑇 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒́𝑓𝑒́𝑟𝑒𝑛𝑐𝑒 𝑒𝑛 𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑚𝑒𝑠 𝑑𝑒 𝑝𝑒𝑟𝑓𝑜𝑟𝑚𝑎𝑛𝑐𝑒, 𝑑𝑒 𝑡𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒 𝑒𝑡 𝑑𝑒 𝑟𝑒𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑛𝑠𝑎𝑏𝑖𝑙𝑖𝑡𝑒́ 𝑠𝑜𝑐𝑖𝑒́𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒 » avec comme objectif commun : la satisfaction client.


Quelle est ta contribution en tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre DATA 🌟 ?


En tant que Data Analyst au sein du Chapitre Data, tu seras accueilli.e comme un véritable moteur à notre efficacité collective, au même titre que tous les membres du Chapitre.


Intégrant une communauté dynamique et experte de plus de 30 collaborateurs, tu auras un impact direct et mesurable sur les services autour de la Data destinés à nos Pôles Produits IT et nos collaborateurs en Caisses régionales.


En tant que spécialiste du traitement de la donnée, tu seras amené à extraire et exploiter les données métiers exposées, les restituer sous forme de Tableaux de Bords et d’en mener des analyses en lien fort avec les métiers concernés. Tu chercheras constamment à faciliter la prise de décision des métiers via la data ; véritable levier de création de valeur métier.


𝐓𝐮 𝐚𝐮𝐫𝐚𝐬 𝐥’𝐨𝐩𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭𝐮𝐧𝐢𝐭𝐞́ :



🚀 Participer à des projets excitants en couvrant des cas d’usages Data variés :


  • Contribuer à la mise en œuvre de cas d’usages Data sur des domaines et des enjeux métiers variés


  • Collaborer en transverse avec différentes Squads et ainsi des acteurs multiples


  • Echanger et améliorer les pratiques de Fabrication avec les autres membres du Chapitre du site de Lyon mais aussi ceux des autres sites France


🔍 D’apporter ton expertise d’analyse de la donnée pour répondre à des besoins métiers à forts enjeux bancaires :


En collaborant étroitement avec les Business Analystes afin d’identifier les besoins Data du métier grâce à des ateliers d’affinage


En collectant et exploitant les données pour les restituer sous forme d’indicateurs ou de Tableaux de bord, et ainsi contribuer et conduire les analyses Data mises en lien avec les problématiques métiers


En présentant les résultats aux équipes métiers


En étant un véritable référent et ambassadeur de la Data sur des sujets transverses


En véhiculant auprès des métiers le cadre de gouvernance Data (Data Management, Data Privacy…) de l’entreprise, en portant les messages et expertises autour du Digital


En contribuant à l’évolution des pratiques du Chapitre dans une logique d’amélioration continue


💻 D’utiliser et d’améliorer au quotidien nos outils et nos process d’analyses :


  • Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord via Microstrategy (sur des activités BI)


  • Calcul d’indicateurs via script SQL sur environnement Teradata (sur des activités BI) et intégration dans des pipelines de restitution normées


  • Mise en œuvre du Tracking sur les parcours utilisateurs et Fabrication de Tableaux de Bord pour restituer les données aux métier (sur des activités Parcours Digitaux) - Logiciel et solutions analytiques : Tag Commander, Piano Analytics, Cosmo Survey


  • Conduite des analyses marketing sur la base du tracking déployé et force de proposition sur les possibles optimisations lors de ces analyses.


Ta vie au sein de notre Equipe :


✅ Un environnement de travail axé sur la qualité et l’intelligence collective.


🌟 L’opportunité de favoriser le quotidien de nos conseillers en agence et la satisfaction de nos 21 millions de clients à travers la France.


👪 Un accueil personnalisé assuré par tes collègues en complément du management et des référents RH pour vous aider à maximiser votre potentiel


🧠 Des sessions collaboratives de brainstorming et de résolution de problèmes pour favoriser l'innovation


💬 Un accès continu à la connaissance grâce à un catalogue très riche de formations en savoir-faire et en savoir-être, des accès aux salons, conférences et événements (Devoxx, DevFest, Vivatech, Salon de la data et de l’IA, ..) pour rester à la pointe des dernières tendances et meilleures pratiques


🌟 Participer activement aux activités "d’innovation" via des ateliers d’idéation technique et par la mise en place de nouvelles pratiques agiles.


🧠 Nourrir ta curiosité et ta soif d'apprentissage dans un environnement qui encourage la croissance professionnelle.



Découvrez le site de Lyon



𝐂𝐞 𝐪𝐮𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐟𝐚𝐢𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐩𝐨𝐮𝐫 𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫 𝐭𝐚 𝐯𝐢𝐞 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐟𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 𝐞𝐭 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐨𝐧𝐧𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐞 :


Nous te proposons :


🚀 De participer à l’évolution de CA-TS en matière de performance, de technologie et de responsabilité sociétale : participation aux projets d’entreprise, développement de la fabrication responsable, contribution à la diminution de notre empreinte carbone.


👥De rejoindre CATECHS : LA communauté des techs de CA-TS. Et y retrouver des Techtalks, des sérious games, du Mob Programming, de la veille techno…


👨‍💻 De prendre part à des projets agiles complexes et innovants, de bout en bout : volumétrie clients importante, diversité technologique et métier, relation étroite avec tous nos clients (Conseillers bancaires en Caisses Régionales, clients du Crédit Agricole)


🏦 D’évoluer dans un environnement alliant modernité (espaces agiles et de créativité, télétravail) et prônant la Qualité de Vie au Travail (équilibre vie professionnelle/vie personnelle, avantages parentalité, forfait mobilité durable)


👫 De faire partie d’une entreprise motrice sur la diversité et l’égalité (94/100 sur l’index égalité Femmes / Hommes qui évalue la politique en matière d’égalité salariale et promotion entre femmes et hommes.)


🌿 De rejoindre une entreprise labélisée numérique responsable qui participe aux enjeux de sobriété et d’inclusion numérique (par exemple l’écoconception et l’accessibilité numérique) qui sont au cœur de la fabrication


🧠 De continuer à développer tes compétences et connaissances, à être accompagné∙e ou accompagner à ton tour (formations, intégration, mentoring, mobilité interne, actions marque employeur)


⭐ De faire évoluer ta carrière professionnelle et t’investir durablement (mobilités interne et groupe).





𝐓𝐨𝐮𝐭 𝐜̧𝐚, 𝐞𝐧 𝐭𝐞 𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐦𝐞𝐭𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐭 :


💻 D’être cadre au forfait en ayant de la flexibilité sur la gestion du temps de travail, tu pourras travailler à distance 2 jours par semaine.


🏖 De disposer, en moyenne chaque année, de 46 jours de congés, et un compte épargne temps pour vous reposer et faire ce que vous aimez chaque année.


👪 D’avoir la possibilité de recevoir un intéressement important en lien avec les résultats de CATS.


🚎🌿 D’avoir un remboursement à hauteur de 75% de tes transports en commun / une Prime mobilité verte de 500 euros par an.


💳 D’avoir accès à un restaurant d’entreprise, aux avantages bancaires et assurances du Groupe CA, un CSE compétitif ainsi que d’une excellente couverture santé pour prendre soin de vous et de votre famille.


💟 De participer au programme de l’arrondi sur salaire au bénéfice d’associations...



𝐀̀ 𝐪𝐮𝐨𝐢 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐞𝐦𝐛𝐥𝐞𝐫𝐚 𝐭𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐮𝐬 𝐝𝐞 𝐫𝐞𝐜𝐫𝐮𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭 ?


- Un premier échange avec ta Talent acquisition Spécialiste Mélissa- 1h

- Un test technique + un second échange avec un ou une de nos expert.es - 1h

- Un dernier échange avec Marieke ta future Leader ! - 1h


« 𝑃𝑎𝑟𝑐𝑒 𝑞𝑢𝑒 𝑙𝑒 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑛𝑒 𝑑𝑜𝑖𝑡 𝑝𝑙𝑢𝑠 𝑒̂𝑡𝑟𝑒 𝑢𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑝 𝑒𝑛 𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑟𝑒𝑝𝑟𝑖𝑠𝑒, 𝑛𝑜𝑢𝑠, 𝐶𝑟𝑒́𝑑𝑖𝑡 𝐴𝑔𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑜𝑙𝑒 𝑇𝑒𝑐ℎ𝑛𝑜𝑙𝑜𝑔𝑖𝑒𝑠 𝑒𝑡 𝑆𝑒𝑟𝑣𝑖𝑐𝑒𝑠, 𝑎𝑣𝑜𝑛𝑠 𝑜𝑢𝑣𝑒𝑟𝑡 𝑛𝑜𝑠 𝑚𝑒́𝑡𝑖𝑒𝑟𝑠 𝑎̀ 𝑡𝑜𝑢𝑠 𝑙𝑒𝑠 𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑠, 𝑠𝑎𝑛𝑠 𝑒𝑥𝑐𝑒𝑝𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛.»

Title: DATA ANALYST - VALUE & PERFORMANCE
Place: San Sebastián de los Reyes, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Supongo que muchos de vosotros conoceréis Decathlon, pero por si acaso, Decathlon es un retailer de deporte y bienestar con 1.600 tiendas en más de 70 países, movilizados por un mismo sentido




MOVE PEOPLE THROUGH THE WONDERS OF SPORT




Con la evolución de nuestro modelo de negocio y el crecimiento digital actual, nos estamos enfrentando a complejos desafíos a gran escala que requieren del mejor talento para superarlos con éxito y poner la Inteligencia Artificial al servicio de las personas.




Quién eres

Te apasionan la tecnología, el deporte y los datos
Jugar en equipo te da energía. Colaborar y crear de forma colectiva con personas a tu alrededor forma parte de quien eres.
Te gusta explorar, crear, descubrir, no dejas ningún detalle al azar. Aprendes haciendo y rehaciendo
Estás dispuesta(o) a enfrentarte a lo desconocido, te motiva el reto y el desafío
Ves una oportunidad cuando las cosas cambian a tu alrededor.
Te gusta emprender. Disfrutas tomando responsabilidades y no te preocupa equivocarte tomando decisiones (no te preocupes, a nosotros tampoco)
Disfrutas con el análisis y la anticipación y eres muy organizada(o)
Eres un(a) gran comunicador(a) . Disfrutas compartiendo tu conocimiento y lo haces de forma clara y sencilla.
Te preocupa la sostenibilidad y actúas para generar un menor impacto en el medio ambiente




Qué harás

Acompañaras al equipo de Value & Performance mediante el manejo y análisis de los datos de la actividad centrado en un análisis de mercado.
Contribuirás / Acompañarás la toma de decisiones mediante el análisis descriptivo , y el diagnóstico a través de los datos con los que aconsejarás planes de acción. En particular a identificar patrones
Construirás informes , visualizaciones y cuadros de mando con herramientas de exploración y autoservicio como Tableau.
Realizarás análisis exploratorio de datos desde fuentes primarias mediante consultas a bases de datos con SQL
Utilizaras técnicas estadísticas básicas para elaborar por ejemplo regresiones, distribuciones , o análisis de variabilidad
Realizarás análisis predictivos para ayudar en la anticipación de la actividad y la previsión de la evolución de sus métricas clave
Estarás en contacto permanente con el equipo de Data e IA para la coordinación de acciones y proyectos, así como con la dirección comercial.
Formarás parte de una comunidad de analistas de la empresa vinculados a otras áreas de negocio con los que compartirás información, experiencias y conocimiento
Estarás en contacto con equipos locales , e internacionales en otros países para la sincronización de trabajos en proyectos conjuntos que elaboramos en común
Serás una parte activa de la gestión del cambio para promover el uso extenso de los datos para la toma de decisiones.




Qué te ofrecemos

Contrato indefinido
Estar rodeada(o) de personas que disfrutan también de trabajar construyendo colectivamente, de compartir, y que disfrutan de los retos y el deporte al ritmo de cada uno.
Formación según una trayectoria que tú construirás, en un entorno que te invitara a tomar decisiones a diario y donde todos consideran que equivocarse también forma parte del proceso.
Entorno de trabajo muy poco jerarquizado donde la toma de decisión está muy distribuida y que favorece la promoción interna
Plan de desarrollo profesional
Libertad y responsabilidad. Ser emprendedor de tu vida, creador de tu propio viaje.




Qué necesitas

Fuertes principios y experiencia práctica contrastable en entornos de Análisis de datos y de datos en el ámbito de conocimiento de mercado.
Experiencia en el diseño de sistemas de visualización de datos
Experiencia en el manejo de hojas de cálculo (Excel, Google Sheets, etc..)
Generación de hipótesis y experimentación mediante tests A/B
Fluidez en Python.
Visualización y análisis de datos con pandas, matplotlib ,numpy y seaborn.
Fuerte experiencia con SQL y en la manipulación de datasets masivos, especialmente en Databricks y BigQuery
Eres un(a) Data Story Maker; te desenvuelves bien y disfrutas explicando los conceptos de Datos y Data Science para hacerlos comprensibles para stakeholders y usuarios
Muy alto nivel de Inglés, hablado y escrito. Lo usarás a diario en tu trabajo
Experiencia trabajando con marcos Agile y experimentación
Te desenvuelves bien con entornos como Databricks y notebooks como Jupyter
Será un plus
Uso de técnicas estadísticas avanzadas
Hablar Francés
Conocimiento de técnicas y librerías de ML
Conocimiento de entornos en la nube como GCP o AWS




Si te sientes identificado/a, tienes ganas y quieres aportar al proyecto de Decathlon. ¡Únete, te estamos esperando!

  • Generación de hipótesis y experimentación mediante tests A/B
  • Fluidez en Python.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Dublin




We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Data Analyst to join a reputable organisation in Dublin. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, with extensive experience in Power BI, Excel and SQL. You will be responsible for analysing complex data sets, creating insightful reports and developing data-driven solutions to support business decision-making.




The Role




Analyse large and complex data sets to provide actionable insights and support decision-making.
Develop, design and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports that effectively communicate data-driven insights.
Use Excel to perform advanced data analysis, including the use of pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros and other functions.
Write and optimise complex SQL queries to extract, manipulate and analyse data from multiple sources.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by validating data and identifying discrepancies.
Design, develop and maintain ETL processes using SSIS.
Automate data workflows and ensure efficient data processing and integration across different systems.
Design and develop custom business applications using Power Apps to streamline business processes.
Integrate Power Apps with other data sources and services for seamless functionality.
Work closely with the business teams, including IT, finance, marketing and operations to understand their data needs and provide solutions.
Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner, making complex data understandable to non-technical audiences.
Identify opportunities to improve existing processes and tools to enhance data analysis and reporting capabilities.




The Person




Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, IT, Mathematics or a related field.
5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or a related role.
Proven expertise in Power BI, Excel, SQL, SSIS, and Power Apps.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and automation.




**All applicants must hold a Stamp 4, EU passport or Irish Citizenship**




Contact David on david@kennedyandpartners.ie | 086 440 3623 for more information on this role or make an easy application through the link provided.

The Person


  • Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, IT, Mathematics or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence or a related role.
  • Proven expertise in Power BI, Excel, SQL, SSIS, and Power Apps.
  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organise and analyse significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team.
  • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
  • Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis and automation.


**All applicants must hold a Stamp 4, EU passport or Irish Citizenship**


Contact David on david@kennedyandpartners.ie | 086 440 3623 for more information on this role or make an easy application through the link provided.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In a fast-changing and uncertain world, the right insights make the difference between seizing an opportunity and missing it entirely. Kline Energy helps energy and mobility clients across the world win in the market through timely advisory services following an agile, client-first organization. Our client base includes global energy companies and regional energy players, you will be able to influence the decisions of the key companies in the Energy industry




Kline recognizes the power of knowledge to anticipate change, unlock value and drive growth.

As a Data Analyst, you will combine strong analytical skills and a strategic mindset with real-world perspectives driven by an understanding of client issues and broader marketplace drivers. You will be working on projects related to different markets, countries globally and will interact with colleagues located in different countries. An Analyst's primary responsibility will be to analyze global markets, develop competitive and technical information, and build solid analysis and insights for client engagements.




Job Description:

As an integral part of the global project team within Kline’s Energy Practice, a Data Analyst will be expected to utilize the best-suited tools to research key markets and develop strategic recommendations for global clients, including:

Use data analytics to enhance clients’ understanding of key business, risk, strategic, or regulatory issues;
Manipulate and analyze large volumes of disparate data to develop critical insights for our clients’ issues, or business decision-making
Build statistical and machine learning models, or custom visualizations and applications, to detect patterns, trends, outliers and drivers among relevant business issues;
Apply predictive analytics, statistical modelling for both internal and external clients.
Assist with the collection, loading, standardization, and identification of relevant data for analysis;
Communicate findings from your analyses to your team members through visuals, data tables and models, and assist with the development of final deliverables, reports, and presentations to be distributed to clients;
Work closely with business stakeholders and experts in order to develop new and innovative tools to support the evolving data landscape, and stay up to date with developments in data analytics, solution architecture and programming languages;
This is NOT a technical IT role.







Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (preferred) with an academic focus on quantitative research (Computer Science and Engineering, Data Analytics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Management Information Systems, or Security Information Systems or related).
In addition, at least 4-6 years of pertinent industry experience in consulting, market research and/or competitive intelligence, or strategic marketing is ideal, with excellent analytical, modelling, strong communication and presentation skills is essential.
Candidates should have strong quantitative, analytical, and conceptual problem-solving skills, combined with outstanding business acumen.
Experience in data visualization using Excel, Power BI, Tableau
This position is currently home-office/remote-based. Kline & Company offers a competitive compensation and benefits package in a supportive work environment.

A AdvanceCare, plataforma especializada na gestão de seguros e planos de saúde, pretende reforçar a sua equipa com novos talentos para integrar uma cultura organizacional dinâmica e inovadora.


Integrado na área de Gestão de Produto, terá como principais responsabilidades:

  • Desenho de modelos preditivos de negócio;
  • Implementar soluções de reporting;
  • Desenvolver relatórios de acompanhamento da evolução do comportamento da carteira;

  • Pensamento crítico.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling

Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

Title: Junior Data Analyst - INTERNSHIP
Company: Toyota Material Handling Manufacturing Italy SpA
Description:
Per il nostro dipartimento di Ricerca e Sviluppo (R&D), all'interno del Project Management Office (PMO), siamo alla ricerca di una/o Ingegnere Gestionale neolaureato. La risorsa avrà l'opportunità di essere inserita all'interno di un percorso di formazione/stage volto ad acquisire una panoramica del dipartimento R&D e del portafoglio progetti, apprendendo il processo di sviluppo prodotto Toyota. In particolare avrà l'opportunità di indagare e acquisire dati significativi dai vari database aziendali, utili per prendere decisioni strategiche di medio-lungo termine.




Obiettivi principali del percorso:




Indagare e raccogliere dati: Raccogliere e analizzare i dati provenienti dai database aziendali con l'obiettivo di individuare tendenze e valutare le prestazioni dei progetti in termini di tempi e costi
Definire dei KPI: creare indicatori chiave di prestazione (KPI) che misurino l'aderenza complessiva dei progetti agli obiettivi di tempi e costi
Creare una Dashboard: sviluppare una dashboard per rappresentare visivamente lo stato complessivo dei progetti




Profilo Ricercato:

La risorsa ideale è una/o neolaureato in Ingegneria Gestionale, vanta una conoscenza ottima di MS Excel e Power Point, gradito Power BI e/o altri strumenti di Business Intelligence. E' desideroso di intraprendere un percorso di formazione volto all'analisi e gestione del dato. Dato il contesto internazionale in cui l'azienda opera, è richiesta una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese. E' richiesta disponibilità ad un percorso di stage formativo/post laurea della durata di 6 mesi. E' previsto un rimborso spese.

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.




Siamo alla ricerca, per una Società del Gruppo, di un profilo di HR Data Analyst, che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Human Resources & Organization.




Principali attività:

Elaborazione periodica degli analytics HR consolidati (per tutte le entità legali del Gruppo)
Gestione end-to-end delle attività di reporting e controlling: dalla raccolta dati all’analisi dei trend
Predisposizione del Budget HR e del costo del personale, e relative analisi di scostamento
Monitoraggio dei KPI HR in coordinamento con le Direzioni (es. monitoraggio ferie, attrition)
Presentazione dei dati analizzati
Garantire standard per data quality e consistency
Supporto ai progetti di HRIS




Requisiti:

Laurea Magistrale, preferibilmente in materie STEM
Un Master in risorse umane sarà considerato un plus
Richiesta pregressa esperienza di 3 anni in posizioni analoghe in Società di Consulenza o in società complesse
Conoscenza base di gestionali HR (Workday e Zucchetti saranno considerati un plus)
Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e Powerpoint
Inglese livello minimo B2
Ottime capacità analitiche
Precisione ed accuratezza
Riservatezza ed affidabilità




Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo;
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove;
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti;
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica;
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri;
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG;
Eccellenti opportunità di crescita.




Cosa offriamo:

Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido;
Ticket restaurant;
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills;
Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (da 32k a 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione.

In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinchè il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.




*****




We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.




We are looking for a HR Data Analyst profile for a Group Company, who will join the Human Resources & Organization Department.




Main activities:




Periodic processing of consolidated HR analytics (for all legal entities of the Group)
End-to-end management of reporting and controlling activities: from data collection to trend analysis
Preparation of HR and personnel cost budgets and related variance analyses
Monitoring of HR KPIs in coordination with Management (e.g. holiday monitoring, attrition)
Presentation of analysed data
Ensuring standards for data quality and consistency
Supporting HRIS projects




Requirements:

Master's degree, preferably in STEM subjects
A Master's degree in Human Resources will be considered a plus
Previous experience of 3 years in similar positions in Consultancy or complex companies required
Basic knowledge of HR management software (Workday and Zucchetti will be considered a plus)
Advanced knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint
English level at least B2
Excellent analytical skills
Accuracy and precision
Confidentiality and reliability




What you will find in Lottomatica

Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world;
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones;
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees;
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica;
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars;
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment;
Excellent growth opportunities.




What we offer:

Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities;
Ticket restaurant;
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills;
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience (32k to 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination.




At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment.




We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for a curious, dynamic and creative graduate to join us as a Junior Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is truly an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Are you passionate about decoding shopper behaviour and using data to answer tough questions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can directly impact business strategies?

By joining our Global Analytical Development Teams as a Junior Data Analyst at Kantar Worldpanel, you'll work with the richest consumer panel dataset in the world, helping global clients understand and predict shopper behaviour across various markets, including FMCG, Tech, Beauty, and Fashion. We expect you to develop expert level data wrangling skills in R, SQL and Python which you’ll be expected to apply to our disaggregated datasets to create analytic solutions as well as having to actively developing Power BI Dashboards to help us tailoring compelling stories to our clients.

You’ll also be able to evolve in a variety of ways – as some of our Data Analyst have gone on to become Data Scientists, Data Engineers or even Project Managers that take on and lead challenging projects. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills depending on business requirements and your interests, you’ll be able to progress onto learning and working with Angular, Databricks, Spark, Docker or Kubernetes. You could end up building front-end applications which help tell stories that our global clients will use to build their business strategies; or even using modelling techniques such as regression, decision trees and clustering.

If you're ready to make a meaningful impact on a global scale, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Support various data-related projects across different departments, by working with diverse data sets to clean, manipulate, and analyse data using tools such as R and Python.
Conduct thorough data quality checks and ensure the integrity of the data.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data.
Understand industry best practices for data modelling to organise the data behind Power BI reports.
Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards in order to translate complex data sets into easy-to-understand visualizations for stakeholders.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).
Demonstrable experience with data analysis, either through academic coursework, projects, or internships.
Comfortable programming skills in R and/or Python will be required.
Experience or knowledge in SQL for database management and querying.
Familiarity with Power BI or other relevant data visualization tools.


With the following qualities…


A passionate learner willing to set aside hours each week to upskill yourself and progress quickly with the tools at your disposal.
Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
2nd Stage – Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.
3rd Stage – Technical interview with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.


Show more
HTML:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for a curious, dynamic and creative graduate to join us as a Junior Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is truly an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Are you passionate about decoding shopper behaviour and using data to answer tough questions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can directly impact business strategies?

By joining our Global Analytical Development Teams as a Junior Data Analyst at Kantar Worldpanel, you'll work with the richest consumer panel dataset in the world, helping global clients understand and predict shopper behaviour across various markets, including FMCG, Tech, Beauty, and Fashion. We expect you to develop expert level data wrangling skills in R, SQL and Python which you’ll be expected to apply to our disaggregated datasets to create analytic solutions as well as having to actively developing Power BI Dashboards to help us tailoring compelling stories to our clients.

You’ll also be able to evolve in a variety of ways – as some of our Data Analyst have gone on to become Data Scientists, Data Engineers or even Project Managers that take on and lead challenging projects. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills depending on business requirements and your interests, you’ll be able to progress onto learning and working with Angular, Databricks, Spark, Docker or Kubernetes. You could end up building front-end applications which help tell stories that our global clients will use to build their business strategies; or even using modelling techniques such as regression, decision trees and clustering.

If you're ready to make a meaningful impact on a global scale, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes

  • Support various data-related projects across different departments, by working with diverse data sets to clean, manipulate, and analyse data using tools such as R and Python.
  • Conduct thorough data quality checks and ensure the integrity of the data.
  • Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data.
  • Understand industry best practices for data modelling to organise the data behind Power BI reports.
  • Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards in order to translate complex data sets into easy-to-understand visualizations for stakeholders.

Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…

  • University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent fields.
  • Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).
  • Demonstrable experience with data analysis, either through academic coursework, projects, or internships.
  • Comfortable programming skills in R and/or Python will be required.
  • Experience or knowledge in SQL for database management and querying.
  • Familiarity with Power BI or other relevant data visualization tools.

With the following qualities…

  • A passionate learner willing to set aside hours each week to upskill yourself and progress quickly with the tools at your disposal.
  • Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
  • Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
  • Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
  • Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
  • Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.

What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...

  • 1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
  • 2nd Stage – Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.
  • 3rd Stage – Technical interview with Hiring Managers.

Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst – Insurance?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Worten, marca de retalho de eletrónica da Sonae, somos, no nosso ADN, uma empresa digital, com lojas físicas e um toque humano e líderes de mercado na nossa área de negócio. Temos como missão levar o melhor da tecnologia (e não só) a todos os consumidores. Com o maior site de e-commerce do País e mais de 240 lojas em Portugal e Espanha, continuamos sempre próximos dos clientes, disponibilizando preços baixos, atendimento personalizado, variedade de produtos e também de serviços, com vista a corresponder às suas necessidades e expectativas. Sempre


Na Direção Digital Business estão todas as pessoas que trabalham para solidificar e fazer crescer o posicionamento da Worten como líder nos canais digitais.


Na Worten promovemos uma cultura de inovação, diversidade, partilha, transparência e trabalho em equipa porque acreditamos que desta forma atingimos melhores resultados.


O teu dia-a-dia:


  • Construir e otimizar reports em Power Bi;
  • Efetuar análises ad-hoc com recurso a modelação da informação em Databricks (SQL ou Python);
  • Analisar e otimizar processos internos e externos relacionados com o funcionamento do marketplace;
  • Implementar e acompanhar os indicadores de desempenho e a qualidade dos processos operacionais;
  • Identificar tendências, padrões e anomalias nos dados como suporte a recomendações a dar à equipa;
  • Identificar e executar oportunidades de melhoria através de automações, utilizando ferramentas low-code (power automate);
  • Estabelecer e manter uma relação de apoio com as demais áreas internas e principais stakeholders da equipa de Marketplace.


O que procuramos:


  • Formação Superior em Gestão, Economia, Engenharia, Gestão Industrial ou áreas relacionadas;
  • Experiência prévia de pelo menos 3 anos em funções semelhantes e de cariz analítico;
  • Domínio de técnicas de consulta e manipulação de base de dados relacionais (SQL e/Python);
  • Boa capacidade analítica e conhecimentos de Excel e PowerBI;
  • Forte orientação para resultados e resiliência;
  • Capacidade de comunicação e de gestão de um leque alargado de stakeholders internos de diversas áreas;
  • Resiliência e elevado driver para entrega de resultados;
  • Elevada capacidade para gerar consenso entre stakeholders e equipas com diferentes visões.


O que oferecemos:


  • Modelo de Trabalho Híbrido (regime atual em vigor de 2 dias presencial e 3 dias remoto).
  • Shuttle até à sede com vários locais de recolha na Grande Lisboa.
  • Práticas de Work Life Balance, nomeadamente 2 dias de férias extra, incentivo aos estudos através da possibilidade de atribuição de bolsas, flexibilidade de horário dependendo da função, entre outras.
  • Práticas de Diversidade e Inclusão.
  • Oportunidades de crescimento através de Formação inicial e contínua adequada às tuas necessidades e objetivos.
  • Vantagens todo o ano em diversas áreas e parceiros.

Sabe mais na área de benefícios e vantagens.


Onde estamos:


  • Presentes em várias localizações e com sede no edifício World Trade Center.

Sabe mais na área onde estamos.



Direto ao que interessa? Candidata-te já!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3 years

Location : Hybrid - Lisbon




Skills Needed?







Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject,
3+ years of experience as data Analyst;
Expertise with Power BI, Tableau, Dataiku, PostgreSQL and ETL tools;
Fluency in English;
The candidate has to be in Lisbon - hybrid position.




Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company

In Toyota Material Handling Europe, we have 13,500 colleagues passionate about supporting companies of all sizes with todays and tomorrow’s Material handling challenges. Because we know that our business and our industry are essential and sometimes even critical for you, for daily life and society at large. In our Headquarters in Mjölby and Gothenburg, Sweden and Willebroek, Belgium, in our Sales companies across Europe or in our Factories in France, Italy and Sweden, you can be part of an extraordinary journey. And together we will Move the world towards easy and sustainable.

Time for you to make a MOVE!




About the Role

You will be part of the TMHE Purchasing Governance Team that oversees the overall structure in Purchasing within TMHE and within all entities located in 20 countries within Europe.

In this position you are responsible to evaluate SAP reports on Vendor Master Data. You will track in the reports data gaps and data errors requiring to be corrected. You will contact the relevant TMHE entities and departments responsible to obtain the correct data to drive correction and will follow up execution of the corrections.

As SAP implementation is an ongoing project at this time, for the entities where SAP is not yet implemented you can assist the implementation teams in evaluating the quality of the data in the current ERP(s), as well as in taking actions to have such data transferred into SAP in a correct and complete format.




Responsibilities

Ensure correctness of Vendor Master Data in SAP.
Drive and follow up date corrections in > 30 TMHE entities in 20 countries.
Track and monitor data errors over time to identify highest error-risk areas (entities / departments).
(Re)train highest risk areas on Master Data Entry to reduce future errors.
As you will work together with TMHE entities across 20 countries within Europe, occasional travel will be required.




Qualifications

Minimum 3 years of experience working with ERP.
Knowledge of SAP (experience in working with Master Data especially) is a major asset.
Knowledge in M3 (current TMHE main ERP) and/or Power BI are an added value, but not an absolute requirement.
Be precise and meticulous in data analysis for correctness and completeness of the data.
Fluent communication in English.
Able to occasionally travel within Europe.




Our offer

In a rapidly growing industry in fast transformation, TMHE is stable, global and influential. We offer a dynamic, diverse, and welcoming local work environment where you always act within an international context. The position is in Bologna but possibility to work remote a few days per month is a natural part of the deal, as is an attractive benefit package and a yearly bonus.




The position is based in Bologna, IT




If you are interested in this career opportunity, please send your Curriculum Vitae no later than 31/07/2024.

We will evaluate applications continuously so please send your application as soon as possible.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About The Role

Uber is looking for Data Analysts to expand its new Team in Krakow.

The Krakow Center of Excellence is taking a new highway to become a major Technology Hub in Central & Eastern Europe, focusing on Process Optimization, Data Analytics & Automation.

After creating queries and dashboards, you will proceed to significant data analyses in order to provide insightful recommendations to Stakeholders, valuable inputs for strategic decisions.

As Data Analyst, you will work together with other Team Members: Process Optimization Specialists and Automation Specialists.

This is a great opportunity if you want to further develop your analytical skills, build sophisticated dashboards, use tools such as Data Studio, Google Sheets or Tableau and create actionable insights for large-scale operations, with concrete impacts.

About The Team

Backing Uber's creativity with operational efficiency. This is the Team's mission statement.

In essence, the Team helps Uber to scale and best serve its users by performing work around two main pillars i) Analytics & Automation - data science, data analysis, query & dashboard creation, automation of business process, ii) Process - design, execution & optimization of business processes.

Located in Krakow, the Team is centralizing work for Uber Rides & Uber Eats, covering two mega-regions, i) United States & Canada, ii) Europe, Middle East, and Africa.

This experience gained as Data Analyst may also, going forward, open doors to plenty of new opportunities across the world, via the Uber Mobility Program.

We're offering a hybrid model of working (50% based out of our Krakow office, 50% work from home).

What You Will Do


Analyze data, identify trends and build meaningful recommendations
Present your results in a concise manner to international Stakeholders
Design, lead & execute projects independently or in coordination with peers
Conduct root cause analyses, build dashboards, prepare data-driven proposals


What you will need


Knowledges in SQL, Google Sheets
Analytical and data-driven approach for solving problems
Ability to work independently, on your own initiative
Motivation to learn all along the way and improve continuously
Excellent written and spoken Communication (in English)

Title: Business Data Analyst - Madrid
Description:
Engel & Völkers lleva más de 40 años en la intermediación de inmuebles residenciales y comerciales de alto standing, contando con unas 800 oficinas en 33 países y en 4 continentes. En España, tenemos una fuerte presencia desde el año 1990 y contamos en la actualidad con más de 80 tiendas.




En el Market Center de Madrid estamos buscando un Business Data Analyst, orientado a apoyar al equipo de operaciones para el crecimiento continuo de Engel & Völkers.




¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?




Construir soluciones pragmáticas, escalables y estadísticamente rigurosas para los problemas y desafíos que podamos enfrentar, aprovechando o desarrollando metodologías estadísticas y de aprendizaje automático.
Responder preguntas generales enmarcando la pregunta, convirtiéndola en un plan analítico, ejecutándola y comunicándola a las partes interesadas.
Ser el punto de contacto y account manager de los diferentes portales inmobiliarios (Idealista, Fotocasa, Habitaclia y otros), así como tener un control diario de nuestros competidores, para trabajar de forma transversal y definir prioridades y/o soluciones.
Analizar en profundidad las métricas operativas y la metodología de Engel & Völkers, para comprender los patrones de comportamiento de nuestros clientes y agentes inmobiliarios, y las posibles áreas de mejora.
Crear, modificar y resolver problemas para garantizar la entrega de análisis e informes precisos y claros.
Proporcionar información para respaldar la toma de decisiones.
Como Business Data Analyst, necesitarás generar confianza con Team Leaders y Sales Directors de todas nuestras oficinas en Madrid.




Ofrecemos:




- Contrato indefinido y jornada completa.




- Horario: De lunes a viernes de 9 a 18h.




- Trabajo en una empresa líder en su sector y formar parte de un equipo de alto rendimiento.




- 22 días laborables de vacaciones y tu día de cumpleaños libre.




- Posibilidad de teletrabajo.




- Acceso al Plan de Retribución Flexible (Seguro médico, Tickets guardería y más)







REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:




Licenciatura en un campo cuantitativo (Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Investigación de Operaciones u otro campo relacionado).
Conocimientos de paquete Office a nivel usuario y nivel de Excel y Google Sheet, preferiblemente avanzado. Valoraremos que tengas conocimientos en Data visualization y en otros software/plataformas estadísticas.
Experiencia iniciando e impulsando proyectos hasta su finalización.
Experiencia comunicando investigaciones complejas de manera clara, precisa y procesable.
Pensador crítico, innovador y solucionador de problemas.
Idiomas: inglés nivel medio.
Posibilidad de movilizarte a todas nuestras oficinas en Madrid.

Title: Data Analyst - Tableau Expert
Description:
Role Details

Data Analyst - Tableau Specialist
Day rate contract
Hybrid working – 4 days onsite in Dublin




Job Scope:

This role would be ideal for someone who enjoys working at the intersection of business and technology, using advanced data visualization tools to enable decision-making while also being comfortable with technical tasks like data modeling and SQL querying. The ability to communicate effectively with senior leadership is critical, as is the flexibility to adapt dashboards and reports to changing business requirements




Primary Responsibilities:




Business Analysis:

Lead projects like the Asset Catalog, working with the Infrastructure Data Engineering team.
Gather, translate, and document business requirements, ensuring they align with technical capabilities.
Collaborate with senior stakeholders to identify their needs and provide analytical solutions.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership in a clear and actionable format.

Tableau Development:

Design, develop, and maintain complex Tableau dashboards to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Translate business requirements into visualizations that provide actionable insights.
Continuously optimize and enhance Tableau dashboards and reports to meet evolving business needs.

Data Engineering:

Support data engineering tasks such as refining data models to ensure they meet the needs of the visualizations.
Work with large datasets using SQL, and perform data manipulations as necessary to support dashboard development.

Key Skills and Experience:

Tableau Expertise: Advanced knowledge of Tableau, including dashboard creation, data modelling, and creating sophisticated visualizations.
Business Analysis: Proven experience in gathering and translating business requirements into technical solutions.
SQL Proficiency: Strong SQL skills for data manipulation and querying large datasets.
Stakeholder Management: Experience working with senior stakeholders and translating business needs into technical solutions.
Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with a high level of attention to detail.




This is a day rate contract role. Please apply if you satisfy the criteria above.

Title: Data Analyst (Python & Power BI)
Description:
📢 🔎 Desde ACCOM, empresa de Marketing Digital orientada en ventas, buscamos nuevo/a compi como en el Equipo de Data & BI, como Data Engineer, con manejo de Power BI y conocimiento en Python!




💡 ¿Qué buscamos en ti?




Dominio en manejo de herramientas de visualización (PowerBI).
Conocimientos en SQL avanzado, desarrollo, gestión y rendimiento.
Experiencia en infraestructura de Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Conocimiento en Python.
Habilidades en analítica de datos orientado a resultados de negocio.
Grado en Estadística, Física, Matemáticas, Economía, Ingeniería Informática o similares.




📝 ¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con los equipos de negocio para comprender sus necesidades analíticas y traducirlas en requisitos técnicos y visualizaciones efectivas.
Diseñar, crear y mantener flujos, informes y paneles de Power BI
Proporcionar soporte y capacitación en el uso de Power BI a los usuarios, ayudándoles a aprovechar al máximo la herramienta.
Analizar y optimizar el rendimiento de consultas SQL.
Trabajar en mapeo de datos, flujo de datos y linaje de datos.
Realizar análisis y evaluaciones de datos para identificar áreas de mejora, oportunidades de crecimiento y eficiencias operativas.




📌 ¿Qué ofrecemos?




Accom es una empresa de carácter joven y competitivo en constante crecimiento. Cuidamos mucho nuestra política de Talento y Cultura, buscando siempre la máxima vinculación de las personas con la empresa. Simplemente tratamos a las personas como nos gustaría que nos tratasen.




📈 Participación en la toma de decisiones.
📅 Flexibilidad horaria.
💻 Posibilidad de teletrabajo en formato híbrido (50%).
💳 Retribución flexible (seguro médico privado, restaurante, transporte y guardería).
📚 Plan formativo acorde a tus necesidades.
💼 Cursos de idiomas ajustados a tu nivel.
🍰 El día de tu cumpleaños libre.
🤼 Eventos y actividades internas para hacer team building.
🏋🏻‍♀️ Descuentos en gimnasios.
📍 Ubicaciones céntricas en Madrid (Callao).




¡Si crees que eres el perfil que buscamos, estaremos encantados de conocerte!

Title: Analista de Datos
Description:
Estamos en búsqueda de un Data Analyst con ganas de superarse día a día para uno de nuestros clientes finales más importantes del sector de energías.




RESPONSABILIDADES:




Administrar y dar soporte con herramientas de consolidación e informes utilizadas en finanzas entorno PowerBI para su correcto diseño, construcción y mantenimiento.
Analizar los flujos de datos en toda la organización e identificar oportunidades de mejora, al tiempo que brindar soporte a las líneas de negocio para garantizar que el sistema satisfaga sus necesidades comerciales.
Contribuir con habilidades técnicas (SQL, Azure ADF, Python, RPA) a las iniciativas de automatización.
Brindar soporte a FP&A, Control y otros líderes funcionales con informes y análisis ad hoc.




HABILIDADES:




Graduado en Ingeniería, Matemáticas y Estadística + Máster relacionado en Data.
+2 años de experiencia trabajando como consultor implementando herramientas de informes o como administrador del sistema de informes.
Conocimientos avanzados en PowerBI.
Ser una persona analítica, con habilidades sólidas para resolver problemas y analizar errores, orientado a resultados y con un enfoque estructurado en el trabajo.
Capacidad para trabajar en equipo y asumir un rol de gestión práctico.
Curiosidad intelectual, alta motivación y deseo de mejora continua.
Inglés: mínimo un C1.




CONDICIONES:




Banda salarial: 35.000 - 40.000€
Beneficios flexibles: seguro de vida, seguro de salud y tickets restuarantes.
Modelo de trabajo: Híbrido, 1 día de teletrabajo.




¡Si te ha interesado y estás en ese punto que quieres hacer un cambio en tu trayectoría profesional este es tu momento, así que no lo dudes y aplica!
