Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (hybrid - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

  • BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math or a similar area;
  • Experience in data workflow creation (data preparation and data reconciliation) in Alteryx or similar data analytics tools (for example Dataiku, Knime, etc.);
  • Experience with Business Intelligence - Data visualization tools, mainly Power BI;
  • Experience to develop and maintain Power Apps and Power Automate solutions;
  • Good knowledge about SQL;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/Data_Analyst”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners










Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued. We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2005 in Lisbon by three visionary entrepreneurs, MoOngy quickly became a leading group in Engineering and Information Technology (IT) across Europe and North Africa. Today, with a presence in 14 countries and more than 40 subsidiary companies, MoOngy employs over 9,500 talents who share a common passion for innovation and excellence.

The International Mobility Recruitment Department is dedicated to enhancing the mobility of IT professionals throughout Europe, facilitating the placement of talents in the various markets where it operates.




Position: Data Analyst

Location: Belgium

Type: Hybrid




Power Skills:

You are ready to work on global projects and contribute to digital transformation across various industries;
You wish to expand your career beyond national borders and you are ready for an European adventure;
You want to be part of a global community of innovators.




Technical and Soft Skills:




We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in PowerBI, Python, and Data Bases (SQL). As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, creating visualizations, and generating insights to support data-driven decision making within our organization. You will work closely with stakeholders from various departments to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant analysis and reports. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proficient in data manipulation and analysis, and has a strong understanding of database concepts and data visualization techniques.




Responsibilities

Conduct data analysis using various tools and techniques, including PowerBI, Python, and SQL
Develop and implement data models and databases to support data analysis and reporting
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide them with timely and accurate analysis and reports
Identify trends and patterns in data and provide insights and recommendations based on analysis
Cleanse and transform data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate data findings
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques




Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a similar industry
Proficiency in PowerBI, Python, and SQL for data analysis and visualization
Strong knowledge of database concepts and ability to work with large datasets
Familiarity with data modeling and database design principles
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with minimal supervision
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex ideas in a clear and concise manner
Fluent inEnglish is mandatory
Fluency in French (C2 level) or Dutch (C1 level) is mandatory
Candidates must be in Europe already




Advantages of joining MoOngy:

International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.

Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies in different countries and various sectors.

Continuous Learning: Access to ongoing and free training and career-oriented certifications.

Personal Growth: Exchange of ideas and best practices among professionals across Europe, fostering creativity and innovation in IT.

Global Citizen in the World of Technology: Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.




@MoOngy Group we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills needed for the position are welcome!

Show more
HTML:
Founded in 2005 in Lisbon by three visionary entrepreneurs, MoOngy quickly became a leading group in Engineering and Information Technology (IT) across Europe and North Africa. Today, with a presence in 14 countries and more than 40 subsidiary companies, MoOngy employs over 9,500 talents who share a common passion for innovation and excellence.

The International Mobility Recruitment Department is dedicated to enhancing the mobility of IT professionals throughout Europe, facilitating the placement of talents in the various markets where it operates.


Position: Data Analyst

Location: Belgium

Type: Hybrid


Power Skills:

  • You are ready to work on global projects and contribute to digital transformation across various industries;
  • You wish to expand your career beyond national borders and you are ready for an European adventure;
  • You want to be part of a global community of innovators.


Technical and Soft Skills:


We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in PowerBI, Python, and Data Bases (SQL). As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, creating visualizations, and generating insights to support data-driven decision making within our organization. You will work closely with stakeholders from various departments to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant analysis and reports. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proficient in data manipulation and analysis, and has a strong understanding of database concepts and data visualization techniques.


Responsibilities

  • Conduct data analysis using various tools and techniques, including PowerBI, Python, and SQL
  • Develop and implement data models and databases to support data analysis and reporting
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide them with timely and accurate analysis and reports
  • Identify trends and patterns in data and provide insights and recommendations based on analysis
  • Cleanse and transform data to ensure accuracy and consistency
  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate data findings
  • Stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques


Requirements

  • Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics
  • Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a similar industry
  • Proficiency in PowerBI, Python, and SQL for data analysis and visualization
  • Strong knowledge of database concepts and ability to work with large datasets
  • Familiarity with data modeling and database design principles
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to work with minimal supervision
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex ideas in a clear and concise manner
  • Fluent inEnglish is mandatory
  • Fluency in French (C2 level) or Dutch (C1 level) is mandatory
  • Candidates must be in Europe already


Advantages of joining MoOngy:

International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.

Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies in different countries and various sectors.

Continuous Learning: Access to ongoing and free training and career-oriented certifications.

Personal Growth: Exchange of ideas and best practices among professionals across Europe, fostering creativity and innovation in IT.

Global Citizen in the World of Technology: Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.


@MoOngy Group we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills needed for the position are welcome!

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company: Allegis Group is the fourth largest staffing company in the world and consists of several specialist operating companies. We have over 23,000 employees, located within 400 offices globally. Our experience and expertise allow us to build strong relationships with clients who value our involvement in solving their challenges.




About the Role: The Front Office Technology Team's primary duty is to support the region (through technology) to achieve its revenue goals. The team does this by innovating on behalf of our sales customers; through process efficiencies; identifying trends and adjusting our approach; managing third-party relationships, and by showing the business what good looks like and what is possible. Our Information Services teams are responsible for all core enterprise technologies such as Outlook, allowing the Front Office Technology Team to focus on revenue growth activities.




Responsibilities:

Supporting strategic initiatives, projects and implementations delivered by the Front Office Technology team.
Take an active role in partnering and managing third-party supplier relationships across Europe. This will include negotiating commercials, identifying training needs and provisioning of accounts.
Troubleshooting issues and problems across those technologies which Front Office Technology manage.
Support the build and maintenance of activity dashboards, along with activity trends analysis.
Partner with Sales leaders and other stakeholders to identify process improvements in line with the business priorities.
Support and manage ad-hoc projects.
Proactively streamline and automate existing processes and act as the first point of contact for core workstreams.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree preferred




Required Skills:

Natural team player

Customer-focused, helpful and willing to support at all times

Advanced Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

Passionate about using and manipulating data to solve business challenges

Strong communication skills

Ability to work under pressure, manage high workloads whilst maintaining the ability to organise and prioritise

Flexible style to accommodate shifting business priorities

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Previous working experience within CRM tools, ideally Salesforce

Build relationships and provide ongoing coaching to individual users and the Professional Development team for core suppliers

Problem-solving and root cause identification skills

Have in-depth knowledge of the Recruitment industry, services and products, along with their application.

Knowledge of the I.T. Services and/or Staffing Industry

Experience leveraging technology to enhance a Sales workforce's productivity

Experience in B.I./Data Analytics

Strong problem solving and analytical skills

Strong decision-making ability

Proven track record in training and coaching

Recognised subject matter expert in CV database and job posting technology, with a strong knowledge of how a recruiter should Source effectively using these channels




Preferred Skills:

Ability to build/maintain relationships at all levels

Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations

Creative approach to solving business challenges.

Positive influence on those around you

Open to feedback

Takes responsibility and is accountable for own performance

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.







Job Title - Data Analyst

Location : Copenhagen, Denmark

Joining - Immediate Joiner

Working Model - Hybrid (2 days work from office)

Detailed description of work task to be carried out

Work as an IT analyst Designer , Data Modeler and Data Analyst
Minimum 10 years of experience
Strong in SQL
Understanding business requirements and converting them to IT requirements
Participating conducting meetings with business BA or framework SME to capture requirements
Performing data and object level analysis for identifying IT solution More
Ability to write SQL Queries back track data
Description of knowledge and experience
Previous experience of banking and financial regulatory framework data models would be a huge plus
Experience of data analysis and modelling
Hands on experience of advanced SQL for query execution
Experience of Scrum Agile methodologies
Ability to understand data warehouse architecture
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical design for development
Ability to understand data models from both business and technical perspective Logic Physical Symantec Layer
Ability to understand technology and technical perspectives RDMS Teradata Snowflake
Understanding of regulatory frameworks such as FINREP COREP etc
Experience and knowledge of financial regulatory reporting and data attributes
Ability to communicate effectively with both business stakeholders and IT experts
Supporting testers in root cause analysis of incidents

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client based in Westmeath is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the team on a perm basis. The Data Analyst will be working in areas such as Big Data, Machine Learning and AI. You will work at the forefront of Data Analytics development, using the latest technologies and tools to build for their ground breaking solutions.




Job Responsibilities

Experienced and independent subject matter expert, capable of working on own initiative whilst delivering best practice solutions that deliver the strategic objectives.
Excellent problem solving skills
Strong quantitative analysis skills and experience in developing calculations to interpret and assess data sets to produce insight




Experience Required

Have a min of 5 years data analysis & reporting experience
Can demonstrate an ability to identify insights and report those insight’s to stakeholders.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience in data querying, data mining, data segmentation.
Strong understanding of Business Intelligence strategies/design as it relates to Data analysis.
2+ years experience using statistical analysis languages (R, Python, etc.).




Essential and Desirable Skills

Financial Services




Educational Requirements

Relevant Degree




Working Hours & Benefits

38 Hour Working Week
Pension
Healthcare
Bonus

Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
¿Te apasionan los viajes , la cultura y el ocio y tienes ganas de participar en el crecimiento de la empresa Nº 1 en servicios turísticos en español?

Nuestro equipo no para de crecer y buscamos personas con talento e ilusión por desarrollarse. Somos un equipo joven, multicultural e innovador que entiende cada día como un desafío y una nueva oportunidad para crecer junto con la empresa.

Si quieres conquistar el mundo con nosotros, ¡te estamos esperando!

Buscamos una persona para unirse a nuestro Departamento de Data como Data Analyst Intern en nuestras oficinas en Madrid.

Como Data Analyst Intern en Civitatis, trabajarás junto con el resto del equipo de datos transformando grandes volúmenes de datos en insights accionables que impulsen la toma de decisiones estratégicas en toda la organización. Durante la beca, trabajarás junto con una de nuestras data analysts, colaborando estrechamente con varios departamentos para optimizar las operaciones y mejorar la experiencia del cliente. Desde el primer día, tu rol será clave para garantizar que Civitatis continúe siendo líder en el mercado de actividades turísticas, utilizando el análisis de datos para innovar y superar las expectativas de nuestros viajeros.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?


Desarrollar y mantener dashboards y reportes que proporcionen insights clave a diferentes áreas de negocio.
Analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para identificar tendencias, anomalías y oportunidades de mejora en el negocio.
Colaborar con el equipo de Data Science para implementar modelos predictivos y prescriptivos que mejoren la toma de decisiones.
Realizar análisis ad hoc para responder a preguntas específicas de los stakeholders.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de IT para asegurar la calidad y accesibilidad de los datos.
Proponer y ejecutar mejoras en los procesos de recopilación y análisis de datos.
Participar en proyectos interdepartamentales para promover una cultura data-driven en la organización.
Asesorar a los equipos de marketing, ventas y operaciones sobre la interpretación y aplicación de los análisis de datos.



¿Qué buscamos?


Título universitario en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática o campo relacionado.
Conocimientos avanzados en SQL, Python
Experiencia con herramientas de BI como PowerBI o Tableau.
Experiencia trabajando con grandes bases de datos y sistemas de almacenamiento de datos.
Curiosidad y muchas ganas de aprender cosas nuevas
Fuerte capacidad para traducir análisis complejos en recomendaciones claras y accionables
Inglés B2



¿Por qué Civitatis?


Formarás parte del líder mundial de reserva online de excursiones y visitas guiadas en español.
Espíritu joven, viajero y gran ambiente de trabajo. ¡20 nacionalidades!
Eventos de teambuilding (desayunos, “first thursday”, padel, senderismo, actividades deportivas, etc.).
¡Equipo sano, equipo feliz! Tenemos fruta siempre a mano y clases de yoga gratuitas.
Podrás disfrutar de nuestras más de 90.000 actividades con un super descuento.



¿Te sumas ?

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Europa Factor S.p.A. intermediario finanziario vigilato da Banca d’Italia, tra i leader nell'acquisto e gestione di crediti NPL nel mercato italiano, è alla ricerca di un Data Analyst.


Se sei un Data Analyst con comprovata esperienza nel settore, inviaci la tua candidatura.


Requisiti:

  • preferibile laurea magistrale in Matematica, Economia o Ingegneria Gestionale;
  • esperienza di almeno 3 anni in contesti aziendali;
  • capacità organizzative e gestionali;
  • capacità di raccolta e organizzazione dati;
  • capacità di analisi dati;
  • ottime capacità di utilizzo strumenti Excel, SQL, Access e Power BI;


Responsabilità:

  • creazione di report operativi e dashboard direzionali;
  • gestione e controllo delle attività operative;
  • gestione dei flussi informatici per aggiornamento pratiche;
  • monitoraggio processi;
  • analisi andamenti operativi;
  • supporto strategie direzionali.


I dettagli sui piani retributivi, il percorso di crescita e le opportunità di formazione continua saranno presentati durante il colloquio conoscitivo.


Unisciti a Europa Factor S.p.A. e porta la tua competenza al servizio dell'eccellenza nella gestione dei crediti.

Title: Data Analyst - Corporate Reporting
Description:
Nature and aim of the position

You have a strong product instinct and eagerness for data-centric analytical products? You are passionate about data and interested to see how Business Intelligence (BI) solutions are used in digital transaction environments such as tax free shopping business?

If you are a business-oriented person with curiosity for data and sharp attention to details, then we are looking for someone just like you to join our Data & Business Intelligence team in and help us with implementing best in class approach for Corporate reporting and analysis in order to protect Global Blue Valuable asset while enabling efficient innovation long term.

Reporting to the BI Corporate Reporting Manager and within the Data & Analytics Unit of Value, you will be participating to the create reports to be used at Corporate level and to define key KPI for Corporate strategies and activities.




Main duties and responsibilities




Support the production of bespoke Corporate reports
Executing business analysis for internal stakeholders leveraging Global / corporate best practices
Analyse & Support internal users requests for data and analytics to be deployed into BI solutions platform
Identify opportunities to improve production efficiency and contribute to the development of business strategy




Background and Education




A Bachelor's degree, preferably in Analytics, Statistics or Economics
3-5 years of working experience as a data / Business analyst in charge of developing and producing performance reports for internal / external clients
Proven ability to manage, transform and extract large volumes of data
Attention to detail and curious to understand how business performance is structured across different drivers
Advanced knowledge of analytic tools (Tableau and / or Micro Strategy are a plus)
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft SQL for data extraction and manipulation is a plus
Basic knowledge of data science tools like R / Python is a plus
Advanced mastery of Office tools especially Excel
Fluency in English is a must

Specific skills and knowledge

Attention to details to deliver against senior management stakeholders expectations
Solid communication skills demonstrated
Experience in working with dislocated teams in a global, multicultural environment
Experience in handling demanding stakeholders from different technical/business areas and tight timelines
You have a strong curiosity to find out how products and systems work and are inquisitive and proactive
Ability to work independently

Additional comments: Agile working model - 2 days / week in office

Title: Trainee Data Analyst
Description:
La empresa:




En VIBIA trabajamos para mejorar la vida de las personas, ayudándoles a crear y disfrutar de mejores espacios donde vivir o trabajar: “Better spaces, better lives”.

Aspiramos a liderar la nueva iluminación, que va más allá de la luz. Una iluminación que tiene como objetivo crear espacios y atmósferas que generen emociones y sensaciones y que tengan un impacto positivo en las personas. “Design beyond light”.

Pretendemos ser promotores del talento creativo y de la sostenibilidad.y... ¡Nos encanta la tecnología!

Estamos buscando a alguien para nuestra área de IT, apasionado por ayudar a la organización hacer que las partes interesadas vean y entiendan el verdadero poder y valor de los DATOS.




¿Cuáles serán tus funciones?




· Colaborar en la obtención de requerimientos y necesidades de los stakeholders.

· Crear visualizaciones de datos para permitir que los stakeholders exploten la información utilizando Power BI.

· Crear pipelines de datos y llevarlos a producción utilizando Data Factory.

· Enriquecer el Data Warehouse de Vibia para satisfacer al máximo las necesidades del negocio mejorando la calidad del dato y su veracidad.

· Aplicar metodologías ágiles y participar en la mejora continua del equipo.

· Mantener la biblioteca de conocimiento actualizada.




¿Qué esperamos de ti?




· Pasión por los datos

· Buenas habilidades analíticas aplicadas a la definición y conceptualización de modelos de datos.

· Foco en Visualización y tratamiento de datos de negocio.

· Ganas de aprender y hacer transformaciones mediante procesos de ETL.

· Capacidad para convertir un report en datos visuales.

· Capacidad para comunicar ideas y soluciones a los grupos de interés.

· Motivación y mentalidad colaborativa.







Herramientas que sería genial que conocieras:




· Metodologías ágiles con JIRA

· Conocimientos en SQL, Phyton y de bases de datos relacionales y no relacionales (Mongo db).




Si no las conoces todas, ¡no te preocupes!, ¡con las ganas de aprender es suficiente para hacerlo bien!




Requisitos:




· Formación en matemáticas, ingeniería, estadística, economía o ADE.

· Posibilidad de realizar un convenio de prácticas, existiendo la posibilidad de contratación al finalizar el periodo.

· Nivel avanzado de inglés (B2)




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Ofrecemos la oportunidad de formarse en una empresa internacional, con un equipo de profesionales en el ámbito del marketing, la comunicación, el diseño y la decoración, líder en su mercado, con un producto de alta gama, reputación e imagen de marca.




¡Únete al equipo Vibia!

Aspiramos a liderar la nueva iluminación, que va más allá de la luz. Una iluminación que tiene como objetivo crear espacios y atmósferas que generen emociones y sensaciones y que tengan un impacto positivo en las personas. “Design beyond light”.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The ideal candidate will use their passion for big data and analytics to provide insights to the business covering a range of topics. They will be responsible for conducting both recurring and ad hoc analysis for business users. 

 

Responsibilities
Understand the day-to-day issues that our business faces, which can be better understood with data
Compile and analyze data related to business' issues
Develop clear visualizations to convey complicated data in a straightforward fashion




Qualifications

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Statistics or Applied Mathematics or equivalent experience
1 - 2 years' Data Analysis experience
Proficient in SQL

Title: Junior Data Analyst - INTERNSHIP
Company: Toyota Material Handling Manufacturing Italy SpA
Description:
Per il nostro dipartimento di Ricerca e Sviluppo (R&D), all'interno del Project Management Office (PMO), siamo alla ricerca di una/o Ingegnere Gestionale neolaureato. La risorsa avrà l'opportunità di essere inserita all'interno di un percorso di formazione/stage volto ad acquisire una panoramica del dipartimento R&D e del portafoglio progetti, apprendendo il processo di sviluppo prodotto Toyota. In particolare avrà l'opportunità di indagare e acquisire dati significativi dai vari database aziendali, utili per prendere decisioni strategiche di medio-lungo termine.




Obiettivi principali del percorso:




Indagare e raccogliere dati: Raccogliere e analizzare i dati provenienti dai database aziendali con l'obiettivo di individuare tendenze e valutare le prestazioni dei progetti in termini di tempi e costi
Definire dei KPI: creare indicatori chiave di prestazione (KPI) che misurino l'aderenza complessiva dei progetti agli obiettivi di tempi e costi
Creare una Dashboard: sviluppare una dashboard per rappresentare visivamente lo stato complessivo dei progetti




Profilo Ricercato:

La risorsa ideale è una/o neolaureato in Ingegneria Gestionale, vanta una conoscenza ottima di MS Excel e Power Point, gradito Power BI e/o altri strumenti di Business Intelligence. E' desideroso di intraprendere un percorso di formazione volto all'analisi e gestione del dato. Dato il contesto internazionale in cui l'azienda opera, è richiesta una buona conoscenza della lingua inglese. E' richiesta disponibilità ad un percorso di stage formativo/post laurea della durata di 6 mesi. E' previsto un rimborso spese.

Show more

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.




Siamo alla ricerca, per una Società del Gruppo, di un profilo di HR Data Analyst, che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Human Resources & Organization.




Principali attività:

Elaborazione periodica degli analytics HR consolidati (per tutte le entità legali del Gruppo)
Gestione end-to-end delle attività di reporting e controlling: dalla raccolta dati all’analisi dei trend
Predisposizione del Budget HR e del costo del personale, e relative analisi di scostamento
Monitoraggio dei KPI HR in coordinamento con le Direzioni (es. monitoraggio ferie, attrition)
Presentazione dei dati analizzati
Garantire standard per data quality e consistency
Supporto ai progetti di HRIS




Requisiti:

Laurea Magistrale, preferibilmente in materie STEM
Un Master in risorse umane sarà considerato un plus
Richiesta pregressa esperienza di 3 anni in posizioni analoghe in Società di Consulenza o in società complesse
Conoscenza base di gestionali HR (Workday e Zucchetti saranno considerati un plus)
Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e Powerpoint
Inglese livello minimo B2
Ottime capacità analitiche
Precisione ed accuratezza
Riservatezza ed affidabilità




Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo;
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove;
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti;
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica;
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri;
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG;
Eccellenti opportunità di crescita.




Cosa offriamo:

Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido;
Ticket restaurant;
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills;
Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (da 32k a 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione.

In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinchè il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.




*****




We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.




We are looking for a HR Data Analyst profile for a Group Company, who will join the Human Resources & Organization Department.




Main activities:




Periodic processing of consolidated HR analytics (for all legal entities of the Group)
End-to-end management of reporting and controlling activities: from data collection to trend analysis
Preparation of HR and personnel cost budgets and related variance analyses
Monitoring of HR KPIs in coordination with Management (e.g. holiday monitoring, attrition)
Presentation of analysed data
Ensuring standards for data quality and consistency
Supporting HRIS projects




Requirements:

Master's degree, preferably in STEM subjects
A Master's degree in Human Resources will be considered a plus
Previous experience of 3 years in similar positions in Consultancy or complex companies required
Basic knowledge of HR management software (Workday and Zucchetti will be considered a plus)
Advanced knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint
English level at least B2
Excellent analytical skills
Accuracy and precision
Confidentiality and reliability




What you will find in Lottomatica

Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world;
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones;
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees;
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica;
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars;
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment;
Excellent growth opportunities.




What we offer:

Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities;
Ticket restaurant;
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills;
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience (32k to 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination.




At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment.




We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for a curious, dynamic and creative graduate to join us as a Junior Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is truly an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Are you passionate about decoding shopper behaviour and using data to answer tough questions? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can directly impact business strategies?

By joining our Global Analytical Development Teams as a Junior Data Analyst at Kantar Worldpanel, you'll work with the richest consumer panel dataset in the world, helping global clients understand and predict shopper behaviour across various markets, including FMCG, Tech, Beauty, and Fashion. We expect you to develop expert level data wrangling skills in R, SQL and Python which you’ll be expected to apply to our disaggregated datasets to create analytic solutions as well as having to actively developing Power BI Dashboards to help us tailoring compelling stories to our clients.

You’ll also be able to evolve in a variety of ways – as some of our Data Analyst have gone on to become Data Scientists, Data Engineers or even Project Managers that take on and lead challenging projects. With us, you’ll have the opportunity to develop your skills depending on business requirements and your interests, you’ll be able to progress onto learning and working with Angular, Databricks, Spark, Docker or Kubernetes. You could end up building front-end applications which help tell stories that our global clients will use to build their business strategies; or even using modelling techniques such as regression, decision trees and clustering.

If you're ready to make a meaningful impact on a global scale, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Support various data-related projects across different departments, by working with diverse data sets to clean, manipulate, and analyse data using tools such as R and Python.
Conduct thorough data quality checks and ensure the integrity of the data.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data.
Understand industry best practices for data modelling to organise the data behind Power BI reports.
Develop and maintain interactive Power BI dashboards in order to translate complex data sets into easy-to-understand visualizations for stakeholders.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).
Demonstrable experience with data analysis, either through academic coursework, projects, or internships.
Comfortable programming skills in R and/or Python will be required.
Experience or knowledge in SQL for database management and querying.
Familiarity with Power BI or other relevant data visualization tools.


With the following qualities…


A passionate learner willing to set aside hours each week to upskill yourself and progress quickly with the tools at your disposal.
Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
2nd Stage – Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.
3rd Stage – Technical interview with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

  • University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Science, or equivalent fields.
  • Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum Required).
  • Demonstrable experience with data analysis, either through academic coursework, projects, or internships.
  • Comfortable programming skills in R and/or Python will be required.
  • Experience or knowledge in SQL for database management and querying.
  • Familiarity with Power BI or other relevant data visualization tools.

With the following qualities…

  • A passionate learner willing to set aside hours each week to upskill yourself and progress quickly with the tools at your disposal.
  • Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
  • Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
  • Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
  • Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work effectively within different cultural and technical environments.
  • Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to comfortably connect with partners at all levels across the organization and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.

What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...

  • 1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
  • 2nd Stage – Screening Interview with Talent Acquisition.
  • 3rd Stage – Technical interview with Hiring Managers.

Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to improve Recruitment Processes and Candidate Experiences all over the world? 🌏




We’re on a journey to make recruitment better for everyone! Let's be fair; it's lacking a bit, and you’ve probably yourself applied for jobs you wish you hadn't. We've all been there, and there's a need for improvement, right? If you “connect” with this problem, good! Because we need someone who wants to help some of the most attractive employers in the world build exceptional and professional candidate experiences for their applicants. Are you all about taking ownership of product performance, ensuring both technical and business KPIs are met and setting the course for our feedback & insights product? Then you should apply for this Data Analyst position. 🎯




Your future team: The Data Team

You will be working with a Data Engineer and a ML Engineer to create meaning from our customers hiring and candidate data and to create the tool for a future of great candidate experience together with the rest of the Product & Tech team. 




What you will be doing: 💪

Data Analysis and Visualization: Use SQL, Looker or other data visualisation tool
Methodology and Modeling: Develop and implement statistical models and quantitative methodologies to support data analysis and decision-making processes both internally at Starred and for our customers through our product
Dashboard Management: Oversee the creation, modification, and maintenance of dashboards, ensuring they provide high-level overviews as well as deep-dive insights into survey data.
Streamlined Deployment: Simplify the deployment process for custom dashboards, enabling quicker setup and onboarding for customers.
Technical Support: Be on the front line answering technical requests, supporting, and educating our customers alongside our Product Specialists and Customer Success Managers.




What competencies you have: 📄

Technical Expertise: Proficient in SQL, with experience in Looker or similar data visualisation tools. We would also expect experience with Python, R or other relevant coding languages
Analytical Skills: Strong background in statistics and quantitative methodology.
Problem-Solving Ability: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with great attention to detail and autonomy.
Communication Skills: Fluent in English (written and spoken).




It’s not necessary, but it would be cool if you also had: 🤠

Experience working in a SaaS company or in a similar technical product management role.
Ability to write and modify LookML code.
Experience in HR or recruitment.




Who we are:




Starred.com is a fast-growing tech company that has become a global industry leader within ‘candidate-centric’ recruitment. The company is the result of a merger between two tech companies (Talenthub & Starred), which have both dominated the space within ‘candidate experience’ for the past few years. Recruitment teams from big enterprises worldwide use our products and services to optimise their hiring experience and employer brand based on valuable insights from jobseekers and hiring managers.




But wait, let’s also tell you about our workplace!We are a team on a mission to pioneer recruitment and make it more candidate-centric worldwide. This demands hard work but, more importantly, a strong team spirit. We care about each other, and we all want every day at the office to be a good experience.

This also means good food and drinks, social events, and the right equipment for you as an employee. We strive to create a friendly, fun environment where everyone can have a say, contribute ideas, and be heard.




We expect this to be a full-time role based in our Copenhagen office. However, we offer a flexible working environment to allow you the space you need to perform at your best every day.




What now?To apply for the position, you only need to upload your CV. After doing so, we’ll get back to you within 10 workdays.If you have any questions about the position, please reach out to CTPO Rune Werliin by email at rune@starred.com.We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: ANALISTA DI DATI
Description:
Time Vision Scarl, Agenzia per il Lavoro accreditata dal Ministero del Lavoro e delle Politiche Sociali ricerca per aziende partner in Lombardia n. 20 Analisti di dati.

Le risorse saranno inserite in contesti aziendali strutturati e si occuperanno di machine learning, big data e tecnologie di archiviazione.

È previsto un percorso iniziale di orientamento e accompagnamento al lavoro e un minimo di formazione in ingresso, tutto gratuito.

Requisiti richiesti:


Residenza in Lombardia;
Età compresa tra i 15 e 34 anni;
Nessun percorso di studio in corso;
Inoccupato o Disoccupato.



Titolo di studio minimo: Licenza media.

Sede di lavoro: Regione Lombardia.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst – Insurance?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Worten, marca de retalho de eletrónica da Sonae, somos, no nosso ADN, uma empresa digital, com lojas físicas e um toque humano e líderes de mercado na nossa área de negócio. Temos como missão levar o melhor da tecnologia (e não só) a todos os consumidores. Com o maior site de e-commerce do País e mais de 240 lojas em Portugal e Espanha, continuamos sempre próximos dos clientes, disponibilizando preços baixos, atendimento personalizado, variedade de produtos e também de serviços, com vista a corresponder às suas necessidades e expectativas. Sempre


Na Direção Digital Business estão todas as pessoas que trabalham para solidificar e fazer crescer o posicionamento da Worten como líder nos canais digitais.


Na Worten promovemos uma cultura de inovação, diversidade, partilha, transparência e trabalho em equipa porque acreditamos que desta forma atingimos melhores resultados.


O teu dia-a-dia:


  • Construir e otimizar reports em Power Bi;
  • Efetuar análises ad-hoc com recurso a modelação da informação em Databricks (SQL ou Python);
  • Analisar e otimizar processos internos e externos relacionados com o funcionamento do marketplace;
  • Implementar e acompanhar os indicadores de desempenho e a qualidade dos processos operacionais;
  • Identificar tendências, padrões e anomalias nos dados como suporte a recomendações a dar à equipa;
  • Identificar e executar oportunidades de melhoria através de automações, utilizando ferramentas low-code (power automate);
  • Estabelecer e manter uma relação de apoio com as demais áreas internas e principais stakeholders da equipa de Marketplace.


O que procuramos:


  • Formação Superior em Gestão, Economia, Engenharia, Gestão Industrial ou áreas relacionadas;
  • Experiência prévia de pelo menos 3 anos em funções semelhantes e de cariz analítico;
  • Domínio de técnicas de consulta e manipulação de base de dados relacionais (SQL e/Python);
  • Boa capacidade analítica e conhecimentos de Excel e PowerBI;
  • Forte orientação para resultados e resiliência;
  • Capacidade de comunicação e de gestão de um leque alargado de stakeholders internos de diversas áreas;
  • Resiliência e elevado driver para entrega de resultados;
  • Elevada capacidade para gerar consenso entre stakeholders e equipas com diferentes visões.


O que oferecemos:


  • Modelo de Trabalho Híbrido (regime atual em vigor de 2 dias presencial e 3 dias remoto).
  • Shuttle até à sede com vários locais de recolha na Grande Lisboa.
  • Práticas de Work Life Balance, nomeadamente 2 dias de férias extra, incentivo aos estudos através da possibilidade de atribuição de bolsas, flexibilidade de horário dependendo da função, entre outras.
  • Práticas de Diversidade e Inclusão.
  • Oportunidades de crescimento através de Formação inicial e contínua adequada às tuas necessidades e objetivos.
  • Vantagens todo o ano em diversas áreas e parceiros.

Sabe mais na área de benefícios e vantagens.


Onde estamos:


  • Presentes em várias localizações e com sede no edifício World Trade Center.

Sabe mais na área onde estamos.



Direto ao que interessa? Candidata-te já!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3 years

Location : Hybrid - Lisbon




Skills Needed?







Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related subject,
3+ years of experience as data Analyst;
Expertise with Power BI, Tableau, Dataiku, PostgreSQL and ETL tools;
Fluency in English;
The candidate has to be in Lisbon - hybrid position.




Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.




Here, you can be totally sure about this: we value each person that joins us. We welcome everyone as part of this family and we do everything we can so that we can learn and grow together.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company

In Toyota Material Handling Europe, we have 13,500 colleagues passionate about supporting companies of all sizes with todays and tomorrow’s Material handling challenges. Because we know that our business and our industry are essential and sometimes even critical for you, for daily life and society at large. In our Headquarters in Mjölby and Gothenburg, Sweden and Willebroek, Belgium, in our Sales companies across Europe or in our Factories in France, Italy and Sweden, you can be part of an extraordinary journey. And together we will Move the world towards easy and sustainable.

Time for you to make a MOVE!




About the Role

You will be part of the TMHE Purchasing Governance Team that oversees the overall structure in Purchasing within TMHE and within all entities located in 20 countries within Europe.

In this position you are responsible to evaluate SAP reports on Vendor Master Data. You will track in the reports data gaps and data errors requiring to be corrected. You will contact the relevant TMHE entities and departments responsible to obtain the correct data to drive correction and will follow up execution of the corrections.

As SAP implementation is an ongoing project at this time, for the entities where SAP is not yet implemented you can assist the implementation teams in evaluating the quality of the data in the current ERP(s), as well as in taking actions to have such data transferred into SAP in a correct and complete format.




Responsibilities

Ensure correctness of Vendor Master Data in SAP.
Drive and follow up date corrections in > 30 TMHE entities in 20 countries.
Track and monitor data errors over time to identify highest error-risk areas (entities / departments).
(Re)train highest risk areas on Master Data Entry to reduce future errors.
As you will work together with TMHE entities across 20 countries within Europe, occasional travel will be required.




Qualifications

Minimum 3 years of experience working with ERP.
Knowledge of SAP (experience in working with Master Data especially) is a major asset.
Knowledge in M3 (current TMHE main ERP) and/or Power BI are an added value, but not an absolute requirement.
Be precise and meticulous in data analysis for correctness and completeness of the data.
Fluent communication in English.
Able to occasionally travel within Europe.




Our offer

In a rapidly growing industry in fast transformation, TMHE is stable, global and influential. We offer a dynamic, diverse, and welcoming local work environment where you always act within an international context. The position is in Bologna but possibility to work remote a few days per month is a natural part of the deal, as is an attractive benefit package and a yearly bonus.




The position is based in Bologna, IT




If you are interested in this career opportunity, please send your Curriculum Vitae no later than 31/07/2024.

We will evaluate applications continuously so please send your application as soon as possible.

As SAP implementation is an ongoing project at this time, for the entities where SAP is not yet implemented you can assist the implementation teams in evaluating the quality of the data in the current ERP(s), as well as in taking actions to have such data transferred into SAP in a correct and complete format.


Responsibilities

  • Ensure correctness of Vendor Master Data in SAP.
  • Drive and follow up date corrections in > 30 TMHE entities in 20 countries.
  • Track and monitor data errors over time to identify highest error-risk areas (entities / departments).
  • (Re)train highest risk areas on Master Data Entry to reduce future errors.
  • As you will work together with TMHE entities across 20 countries within Europe, occasional travel will be required.


Qualifications

  • Minimum 3 years of experience working with ERP.
  • Knowledge of SAP (experience in working with Master Data especially) is a major asset.
  • Knowledge in M3 (current TMHE main ERP) and/or Power BI are an added value, but not an absolute requirement.
  • Be precise and meticulous in data analysis for correctness and completeness of the data.
  • Fluent communication in English.
  • Able to occasionally travel within Europe.


Our offer

In a rapidly growing industry in fast transformation, TMHE is stable, global and influential. We offer a dynamic, diverse, and welcoming local work environment where you always act within an international context. The position is in Bologna but possibility to work remote a few days per month is a natural part of the deal, as is an attractive benefit package and a yearly bonus.


The position is based in Bologna, IT


If you are interested in this career opportunity, please send your Curriculum Vitae no later than 31/07/2024.

We will evaluate applications continuously so please send your application as soon as possible.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Responsibilities




Supporting onboarding activities for our customers, case management and case handling
Resolving customer data related cases (checking data, correcting data, validating data, preparing reports, importing data etc.)
Aligning internally on customer questions with the other team and company colleagues
Generating reports from SQL databases and creating queries
Preparing dashboards for customers and for internal purposes
Working with data maintenance, including importing, extracting, correcting and validating data
Recognizing and adopting best practices in reporting and analysis: data integrity, analysis, validation, and documentation
In-depth working with multiple source data, including extraction, manipulation and modelling




Requirements




Working experience in data extraction, manipulation, modelling and reporting – minimum 2 years
Excellent Excel skills
Advanced SQL skills
Good Power Query skills
Experience creating data models, projections, pivot tables from multiple source data
Strong spoken and written English

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company: Allegis Group is the fourth largest staffing company in the world and consists of several specialist operating companies. We have over 23,000 employees, located within 400 offices globally. Our experience and expertise allow us to build strong relationships with clients who value our involvement in solving their challenges.




About the Role: The Front Office Technology Team's primary duty is to support the region (through technology) to achieve its revenue goals. The team does this by innovating on behalf of our sales customers; through process efficiencies; identifying trends and adjusting our approach; managing third-party relationships, and by showing the business what good looks like and what is possible. Our Information Services teams are responsible for all core enterprise technologies such as Outlook, allowing the Front Office Technology Team to focus on revenue growth activities.




Responsibilities:

Supporting strategic initiatives, projects and implementations delivered by the Front Office Technology team.
Take an active role in partnering and managing third-party supplier relationships across Europe. This will include negotiating commercials, identifying training needs and provisioning of accounts.
Troubleshooting issues and problems across those technologies which Front Office Technology manage.
Support the build and maintenance of activity dashboards, along with activity trends analysis.
Partner with Sales leaders and other stakeholders to identify process improvements in line with the business priorities.
Support and manage ad-hoc projects.
Proactively streamline and automate existing processes and act as the first point of contact for core workstreams.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree preferred




Required Skills:

Natural team player

Customer-focused, helpful and willing to support at all times

Advanced Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

Passionate about using and manipulating data to solve business challenges

Strong communication skills

Ability to work under pressure, manage high workloads whilst maintaining the ability to organise and prioritise

Flexible style to accommodate shifting business priorities

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Previous working experience within CRM tools, ideally Salesforce

Build relationships and provide ongoing coaching to individual users and the Professional Development team for core suppliers

Problem-solving and root cause identification skills

Have in-depth knowledge of the Recruitment industry, services and products, along with their application.

Knowledge of the I.T. Services and/or Staffing Industry

Experience leveraging technology to enhance a Sales workforce's productivity

Experience in B.I./Data Analytics

Strong problem solving and analytical skills

Strong decision-making ability

Proven track record in training and coaching

Recognised subject matter expert in CV database and job posting technology, with a strong knowledge of how a recruiter should Source effectively using these channels




Preferred Skills:

Ability to build/maintain relationships at all levels

Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations

Creative approach to solving business challenges.

Positive influence on those around you

Open to feedback

Takes responsibility and is accountable for own performance

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us:

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 700+ clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world. Powered by nearly 90,000 talented and entrepreneurial professionals across more than 30 countries, LTIMindtree — a Larsen & Toubro Group company — combines the industry-acclaimed strengths of erstwhile Larsen and Toubro Infotech and Mindtree in solving the most complex business challenges and delivering transformation at scale. For more information, please visit www.ltimindtree.com.







Job Title - Data Analyst

Location : Copenhagen, Denmark

Joining - Immediate Joiner

Working Model - Hybrid (2 days work from office)

Detailed description of work task to be carried out

Work as an IT analyst Designer , Data Modeler and Data Analyst
Minimum 10 years of experience
Strong in SQL
Understanding business requirements and converting them to IT requirements
Participating conducting meetings with business BA or framework SME to capture requirements
Performing data and object level analysis for identifying IT solution More
Ability to write SQL Queries back track data
Description of knowledge and experience
Previous experience of banking and financial regulatory framework data models would be a huge plus
Experience of data analysis and modelling
Hands on experience of advanced SQL for query execution
Experience of Scrum Agile methodologies
Ability to understand data warehouse architecture
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical design for development
Ability to understand data models from both business and technical perspective Logic Physical Symantec Layer
Ability to understand technology and technical perspectives RDMS Teradata Snowflake
Understanding of regulatory frameworks such as FINREP COREP etc
Experience and knowledge of financial regulatory reporting and data attributes
Ability to communicate effectively with both business stakeholders and IT experts
Supporting testers in root cause analysis of incidents

Title: Data Analyst
Description:

5+ experience as a Data Analyst with a strong focus on SQL and data analysis.

Experience with PySpark, including writing Spark jobs and working with large datasets.

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights clearly.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
My client based in Westmeath is currently recruiting for a Data Analyst to join the team on a perm basis. The Data Analyst will be working in areas such as Big Data, Machine Learning and AI. You will work at the forefront of Data Analytics development, using the latest technologies and tools to build for their ground breaking solutions.




Job Responsibilities

Experienced and independent subject matter expert, capable of working on own initiative whilst delivering best practice solutions that deliver the strategic objectives.
Excellent problem solving skills
Strong quantitative analysis skills and experience in developing calculations to interpret and assess data sets to produce insight




Experience Required

Have a min of 5 years data analysis & reporting experience
Can demonstrate an ability to identify insights and report those insight’s to stakeholders.
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience in data querying, data mining, data segmentation.
Strong understanding of Business Intelligence strategies/design as it relates to Data analysis.
2+ years experience using statistical analysis languages (R, Python, etc.).




Essential and Desirable Skills

Financial Services




Educational Requirements

Relevant Degree




Working Hours & Benefits

38 Hour Working Week
Pension
Healthcare
Bonus
