Title: Data Analyst Internship
Description:
¿Te apasionan los viajes , la cultura y el ocio y tienes ganas de participar en el crecimiento de la empresa Nº 1 en servicios turísticos en español?

Nuestro equipo no para de crecer y buscamos personas con talento e ilusión por desarrollarse. Somos un equipo joven, multicultural e innovador que entiende cada día como un desafío y una nueva oportunidad para crecer junto con la empresa.

Si quieres conquistar el mundo con nosotros, ¡te estamos esperando!

Buscamos una persona para unirse a nuestro Departamento de Data como Data Analyst Intern en nuestras oficinas en Madrid.

Como Data Analyst Intern en Civitatis, trabajarás junto con el resto del equipo de datos transformando grandes volúmenes de datos en insights accionables que impulsen la toma de decisiones estratégicas en toda la organización. Durante la beca, trabajarás junto con una de nuestras data analysts, colaborando estrechamente con varios departamentos para optimizar las operaciones y mejorar la experiencia del cliente. Desde el primer día, tu rol será clave para garantizar que Civitatis continúe siendo líder en el mercado de actividades turísticas, utilizando el análisis de datos para innovar y superar las expectativas de nuestros viajeros.

¿Cómo será tu día a día?


Desarrollar y mantener dashboards y reportes que proporcionen insights clave a diferentes áreas de negocio.
Analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para identificar tendencias, anomalías y oportunidades de mejora en el negocio.
Colaborar con el equipo de Data Science para implementar modelos predictivos y prescriptivos que mejoren la toma de decisiones.
Realizar análisis ad hoc para responder a preguntas específicas de los stakeholders.
Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con el equipo de IT para asegurar la calidad y accesibilidad de los datos.
Proponer y ejecutar mejoras en los procesos de recopilación y análisis de datos.
Participar en proyectos interdepartamentales para promover una cultura data-driven en la organización.
Asesorar a los equipos de marketing, ventas y operaciones sobre la interpretación y aplicación de los análisis de datos.



¿Qué buscamos?


Título universitario en Estadística, Matemáticas, Informática o campo relacionado.
Conocimientos avanzados en SQL, Python
Experiencia con herramientas de BI como PowerBI o Tableau.
Experiencia trabajando con grandes bases de datos y sistemas de almacenamiento de datos.
Curiosidad y muchas ganas de aprender cosas nuevas
Fuerte capacidad para traducir análisis complejos en recomendaciones claras y accionables
Inglés B2



¿Por qué Civitatis?


Formarás parte del líder mundial de reserva online de excursiones y visitas guiadas en español.
Espíritu joven, viajero y gran ambiente de trabajo. ¡20 nacionalidades!
Eventos de teambuilding (desayunos, “first thursday”, padel, senderismo, actividades deportivas, etc.).
¡Equipo sano, equipo feliz! Tenemos fruta siempre a mano y clases de yoga gratuitas.
Podrás disfrutar de nuestras más de 90.000 actividades con un super descuento.



¿Te sumas ?
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Europa Factor S.p.A. intermediario finanziario vigilato da Banca d’Italia, tra i leader nell'acquisto e gestione di crediti NPL nel mercato italiano, è alla ricerca di un Data Analyst.


Se sei un Data Analyst con comprovata esperienza nel settore, inviaci la tua candidatura.


Requisiti:

  • preferibile laurea magistrale in Matematica, Economia o Ingegneria Gestionale;
  • esperienza di almeno 3 anni in contesti aziendali;
  • capacità organizzative e gestionali;
  • capacità di raccolta e organizzazione dati;
  • capacità di analisi dati;
  • ottime capacità di utilizzo strumenti Excel, SQL, Access e Power BI;


Responsabilità:

  • creazione di report operativi e dashboard direzionali;
  • gestione e controllo delle attività operative;
  • gestione dei flussi informatici per aggiornamento pratiche;
  • monitoraggio processi;
  • analisi andamenti operativi;
  • supporto strategie direzionali.


I dettagli sui piani retributivi, il percorso di crescita e le opportunità di formazione continua saranno presentati durante il colloquio conoscitivo.


Unisciti a Europa Factor S.p.A. e porta la tua competenza al servizio dell'eccellenza nella gestione dei crediti.

Title: Data Analyst - Corporate Reporting
Description:
Nature and aim of the position

You have a strong product instinct and eagerness for data-centric analytical products? You are passionate about data and interested to see how Business Intelligence (BI) solutions are used in digital transaction environments such as tax free shopping business?

If you are a business-oriented person with curiosity for data and sharp attention to details, then we are looking for someone just like you to join our Data & Business Intelligence team in and help us with implementing best in class approach for Corporate reporting and analysis in order to protect Global Blue Valuable asset while enabling efficient innovation long term.

Reporting to the BI Corporate Reporting Manager and within the Data & Analytics Unit of Value, you will be participating to the create reports to be used at Corporate level and to define key KPI for Corporate strategies and activities.




Main duties and responsibilities




Support the production of bespoke Corporate reports
Executing business analysis for internal stakeholders leveraging Global / corporate best practices
Analyse & Support internal users requests for data and analytics to be deployed into BI solutions platform
Identify opportunities to improve production efficiency and contribute to the development of business strategy




Background and Education




A Bachelor's degree, preferably in Analytics, Statistics or Economics
3-5 years of working experience as a data / Business analyst in charge of developing and producing performance reports for internal / external clients
Proven ability to manage, transform and extract large volumes of data
Attention to detail and curious to understand how business performance is structured across different drivers
Advanced knowledge of analytic tools (Tableau and / or Micro Strategy are a plus)
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft SQL for data extraction and manipulation is a plus
Basic knowledge of data science tools like R / Python is a plus
Advanced mastery of Office tools especially Excel
Fluency in English is a must

Specific skills and knowledge

Attention to details to deliver against senior management stakeholders expectations
Solid communication skills demonstrated
Experience in working with dislocated teams in a global, multicultural environment
Experience in handling demanding stakeholders from different technical/business areas and tight timelines
You have a strong curiosity to find out how products and systems work and are inquisitive and proactive
Ability to work independently

Additional comments: Agile working model - 2 days / week in office

Title: Forecast Data Analyst
HTML:
We’re always looking for the ones truly passionate about their work. If you are amongst them, you can rest assured there is a place for you in eMAG. We’ve grown very fast and we are determined to keep doing so. What brought us here is our desire for continuous evolution and practical results.


More than 6000 colleagues are part of eMAG Teams. We strongly believe in people development and therefore every year we invest more and more energy and resources to remain an organization that is constantly learning. We want to make sure that you’ll have the most talented colleagues, as well as the proper environment to grow and achieve great results, to become what you desire on a personal and professional level. Join us, grow faster!


Forecast Data Analyst

What you’ll have to do:

  • Data Analysis: Collect, clean, and analyze historical data to identify trends, patterns, and key drivers of business performance;
  • Forecasting: Develop, test, and implement predictive models to forecast future demand, sales, inventory needs, or other key business metrics;
  • Model Validation: Continuously evaluate and refine forecasting models to ensure accuracy and reliability. Adjust models based on new data and changing business conditions;
  • Reporting: Create and deliver clear and concise reports and visualizations that communicate forecast results and insights to stakeholders, including executives, product managers, and operations teams;
  • Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including marketing, finance, supply chain, and IT, to align forecasting efforts with business needs and ensure data accuracy and consistency;
  • Scenario Analysis: Conduct “what-if” analyses to explore the impact of different scenarios on future outcomes and provide recommendations for strategic decision-making;
  • Data Quality: Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data used in forecasting models. Work with data engineers and IT to resolve any data quality issues;
  • Continuous Improvement: Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in forecasting and data analytics. Propose and implement improvements to existing processes and models.


How we’d like you to be:

  • Education: Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field. A Master’s degree is preferred;
  • Experience: 2+ years of experience in data analysis, forecasting, or a related role. Experience in FMCG is a plus;
  • Technical Skills:
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, and SQL;
  • Advanced knowledge of data models;
  • Knowledge of implementing business processes on the data flow;
  • Strong skills in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI);
  • Analytical Skills: Strong problem-solving abilities and the capability to work with complex datasets;
  • Communication Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner;
  • Attention to Detail: Meticulous in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of data and models;
  • Time Management: Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines effectively.


What we’ve prepared for you:


  • Medical subscription: Medicover, MedLife or Regina Maria.
  • A flexible budget that you can invest in yourself as you wish: meal tickets, holiday tickets, cultural vouchers, private pension, foreign language classes, eMAG, Fashion Days, Tazz, Therme & Genius, membership to different gyms or even professional development classes.
  • Different discounts from our partners: banking, mobile, dental medicine or wellness.
  • Access to the Bookster library and free credits on the Atlas psycho-emotional health platform.
  • An accelerated learning environment, with access to over 100.000 curated online resources and platforms, learning academies and development programs.
  • New headquarters, where sleek design, natural light, and versatile spaces create an energizing and comfortable environment for hybrid work.


Curious to find out more about the next step in your career? Apply now and if your experience is relevant for the role you wish, we will give you a call for more details!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

Uplight is creating a new category of energy. We make software that manages energy resources in homes and businesses—including things like smart thermostats, electric vehicles, solar panels, storage batteries, heat pumps, and even people’s behavior—to generate, shift, or save energy to balance the grid, making it more efficient and reliable. This creates clean energy capacity that can be used by the power grid instead of burning more fossil fuels. Our solutions accelerate the transition to clean energy and save money for energy customers.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to drive our company forward, and help us lead the clean energy revolution!

How You Will Make An Impact


Investigate and explore our diverse datasets and the products that create and use them
Work closely with a broad range of stakeholders, such as Customer Success Managers, Solution Architects, software engineers, and data scientists.
Quality data is key to quality results and you will be responsible for ensuring that the data is complete and accurately represents the customers data
You will work on Data collection initiatives: Gathering information from various sources
You will be responsible for troubleshooting issues resulting from data quality
Build out automation and tooling for recurring reports, including learning and practicing software engineering skills.
Be part of a rapidly growing Professional Services organization as we increase our capabilities to serve Uplight across our entire platform of products and services.
Passion for our mission and the stories we can tell with the data we provide.
Motivation to increase your ownership and responsibilities over time.
Compassion and team spirit to support our clients and your fellow teammates.
Curiosity and drive toward understanding and synthesizing complicated information sources across multiple platforms.
Ability to Identify trends that impact multiple clients or programs, summarize those trends with data, and drive visibility and action for a robust solution.
Transparency and traceability of time spent and internal/external communications.
Creation and maintenance of thorough documentation for data integration processes.
Ability to step back from initial problem statements and anticipate/see the larger issues and develop an action plan to ensure the systematic issue is identified and addressed.
Active communication with other teams to understand upstream and downstream requirements.
Ability to maintain a calm, professional demeanor under pressure.


What You Bring To Uplight


3-5 years' personal, professional, and/or educational experience with one or more of our team's core tasks: accessing data, analyzing data, transforming data, packaging data into reports, and managing relationships with internal and external stakeholders; OR the ability to demonstrate your skill in one or more of these tasks as part of the interview process.
Proficiency in two or more of the following:
Looker
SQL or other structured query languages.
Writing programs or scripts with Python or other languages.
Dashboarding, with an emphasis on automation.
Experience with one or more of: Amazon Web Services S3, Google Cloud Platform, other proprietary web-based applications and technologies of Data manipulation in Microsoft Excel or Looker, Tableau, or other Business Intelligence tools or other skills or training that are thematically similar to the above.
Patient, communicative, team player who is detail-oriented and has outstanding interpersonal skills.
Ability to collaborate across multiple time-zones and communication platforms.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, tenacity, and fortitude.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to balance multiple short- and long-term projects of varying scopes with clients across the country.
Vigorous written and oral communication skills.
Curiosity about and commitment to technology, energy efficiency and your potential.


Bonus Points


Experience working with SaaS, electric/gas utilities, or energy efficiency software.
Exposure to and understanding of Agile and other technical project management methodologies is a plus.
Experience handling personally identifiable information (PII)


Don’t meet every single requirement? Studies have shown that women, marginalized genders and people of color are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. At Uplight we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why Join Uplight in Leading the Fight Against Climate Change?

At Uplight, We're Not Just Offering a Job – We're Offering a Chance To Be Part Of The Solution To One Of The World's Biggest Challenges. As a Certified B Corporation, We're Deeply Committed To Both Social And Environmental Responsibility. Here's Why You Should Join Our Team Of Passionate Uplighters


Make a Meaningful Impact: Your work directly impacts our mission of decarbonization and building a more sustainable future.
Grow Your Career: We offer ample advancement opportunities, robust learning and development programs, and a supportive team environment that fosters collaboration and innovation.
Thrive: We offer comprehensive benefits, including flexible time off, generous parental leave, a wellness stipend, and work flexibility to help you thrive both personally and professionally.
Belong to an Inclusive Community: We celebrate diversity and foster an inclusive workplace where everyone feels respected, empowered, and heard. Our Employee Resource Groups offer opportunities to connect with colleagues who share your interests and backgrounds.
Be Part of a Growing Movement: Join a team of dedicated individuals who are passionate about creating a more sustainable future. We offer a collaborative environment where your ideas are valued and your contributions recognized. Together, we can build a brighter tomorrow.


To learn more about our comprehensive benefits package and other perks, visit uplight.com/careers

Salary Range: $70,000 to $85,000 + Bonus

Application Deadline: July 31, 2024

In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the approximate annual base compensation range is listed above. The actual offer, reflecting the total compensation package and benefits, will be determined by a number of factors including the applicant's experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity among our team.

Title: Product Data Analyst
Description:
Skylight is a technology startup based out of Los Angeles and San Francisco. Our mission is to make technology that brings families together. Our founders are former venture capitalists and serial entrepreneurs, who have scaled this business to $100M+ in annual revenue while being completely bootstrapped. We think often about the thousands of smiles we are able to put on our customers' faces each day, and it fills our hearts with purpose. That's why we have been working hard to expand our team and invent, so that we can continue to bring the magic of Skylight to millions of loved ones throughout the world.

We are ready to hire our first Product Data Analyst to lead our center of excellence for data analytics. This role will enable product, engineering, customer service, marketing, and executive teams by providing insightful data analysis, regular reporting, and self-service tools.

Responsibilities:


Stakeholder Collaboration: Partner with various teams to identify data needs and methodologies
Project Management: Lead data projects independently, ensuring timely delivery
Data Analysis: Collect, structure, and interpret complex data into actionable insights
Dashboard Development: Create and maintain dashboards to communicate performance metrics
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models to support business functions
Tool Utilization: Use tools like Snowflake, dbt, Fivetran, and Metabase for data management and analysis


Continuous Improvement: Automate processes and optimize data delivery.

Requirements


Experience: 3+ years in a data analyst role; 2+ years with large datasets and enterprise data warehouse solutions
Technical Skills: Expert in SQL and familiarity with data tools like Snowflake, dbt, and Metabase
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills
Project Management: Proven project management skills with a focus on autonomy
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment



Benefits

Our competitive compensation package includes:


Competitive Salary + Equity Package
401K matching
Wellness, learning, and home-office budgets
Health, Dental & Vision Medical Plans
Tremendous autonomy to set the direction of your work
Unlimited PTO
Company holidays on the first Friday of every month (Except November & December)


Equal opportunity employer

Skylight is committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. If you're the best person for the job, we want you on board!

For Colorado-based candidates, the range being offered for this role is $120K-140K based on experience and for California-based candidates, the range being offered for this role is $120K-140K based on experience. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider employment for qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of this law.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Material Bank is a fast-paced, high-growth technology company and created the world's largest material marketplace for the Architecture and Design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to start and manage a design project. Learn more about us at www.materialbank.com or see below.

--

Are you passionate about shaping the future of data ecosystems? We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to be at the forefront of innovation, driving the architecture of our cutting-edge data platform. At Material Bank, you'll play a pivotal role in building a modern data infrastructure utilizing advanced technologies like real-time data streams and machine learning-powered insights.

In this role, you'll integrate various data initiatives into a unified schema, establishing a single source of truth across the organization. Your expertise will be critical in defining universal schemas, rationalizing domain data and structures, and empowering our team to make data-driven decisions. This is a rare opportunity to contribute to both B2B and B2C products, impacting high-profile projects that will shape the future of Material Bank.

What you’ll do:


Perform comprehensive data analysis to assess data quality and derive meaningful insights.
Develop and maintain data dictionaries, ensuring all team members have a clear understanding of data definitions and structures.
Prepare and present detailed reports to the executive team, highlighting trends, patterns, and predictions.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and resolve data issues, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Participate in efforts to rationalize domain data and data structures to support business objectives.
Utilize various tools and platforms such as SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and Metabase for data analysis and visualization.
Support in the integration of data streams between Commerce Tools and Salesforce OMS using Kafka streams.
Support the development and implementation of the data catalog, tracking schema changes, data lineage, and metadata tagging.
Monitor and alert for data issues, ensuring proactive identification and resolution.



What you’ll bring:


3+ Years of Experience
Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Finance, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights
Proficiency in SQL, Python, PostgreSQL, and other relevant data analysis tools
Experience with data visualization
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment



What you’ll get from us:


Our people: If you thrive in an inclusive, innovative, and fast-paced organization, look no further! You will get to work alongside some of the brightest minds - Join a genuinely fun and supportive workplace where we keep our employees consistently engaged through internal communication and corporate events
Relaxation and Celebrations: Generous PTO, Sick Days, Paid National Holidays, and even more (ask us about this when we connect).
Health Benefits: We contribute to your medical, dental, vision and short-term/long-term disability plans and have a strong employee assistance program.
Plan for your Retirement: 401(k) eligible after your first 90 day's employed!
Giving Back: We sponsor multiple events throughout the year to help out our communities. You will receive time off to give back as well.
Growth: We’ll help you take your career to the next level. We want you to be creative and take initiative which will allow you to grow and create within the company. Most importantly, be the best at what matters!
Flexible Work Schedules: With business units and employees across the globe, Material Technologies has embraced a hybrid  working model allowing department leaders to decide on the best approach for their respective teams, whether that be remote, in person, or a little of both.



About Material Bank

Material Bank is the world’s largest material marketplace for the architecture and design industry, providing the fastest and most powerful way to search and sample materials. Material Bank connects design professionals to hundreds of manufacturers through facilitating brand discovery, rep engagement, and material sampling.

Material Bank has transformed the way an entire industry discovers and samples materials. By removing the friction that exists in the process, we drive business between architects and designers (members) and our Brand Partners (clients).

Our powerful material database and proprietary robotic distribution facility allow members to order samples until midnight (ET) to be delivered free of charge anywhere in the US, in one box, by 10:30 AM the next morning.

Connect with us and discover your career at Material Bank.

--

Material Bank is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We value diversity, and all applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, veteran or disability status or other status protected under any applicable federal, state or local law.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst/Manager




BVARI seeks a Data Analyst/Manager to develop, organize, and analyze data resources and systems for a study at the VA Boston Healthcare System focusing on the genetics of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias, and to optimize the detection of individuals who have been diagnosed with dementia from data in the electronic medical records. The position will be part of a research group consisting of biomedical researchers, clinicians, epidemiologists, biostatisticians, data analysts/programmers, project coordinators, and informatics team with academic affiliations to Boston University. Candidates should have a service-oriented mentality, high sense of ownership of the assigned tasks and ability to solve problems presented by data.




Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Reporting to the Principal Investigator, the Data Analyst will work closely with statistical programmers, and biostatisticians to identify patient cohorts required for analysis, ensure analysis results are delivered in a timely manner and meet quality standards. Specifically, the Data Manager will be responsible for:

Preparing datasets for analyses and gather study data requirements, pull all necessary data, and perform data cleaning, and aggregation/synthesis as appropriate.
Assist with performing quality control and identify process improvements.
Work with data management team and other data analysts/programmers to design, create and deliver analytical databases, reports, and analyses.
Perform validation of programs and databases to fulfill specifications and ensure integrity of outcomes.
Develop standard and custom research reports (SQL-SSRS) to meet the needs of the program.
Serve as the program expert on EHR requirements, data structure of OMOP records, data quality, and system architecture.
Aid in manuscript preparation, report development, and presentations.
Establish and maintain communication with fellow teammates to keep them updated on the status of their requests.
Ability to manage time across multiple research projects.
Ability to work both independently and within a team.




Qualifications

Master’s degree, preferably in public health domain, statistics, biostatistics, or computer science with relevant skills, or other science degree with ≥ 2 years of data management or analysis experience
Experience in working with big data and capable of working independently in preparing datasets, writing analytic plans, performing analyses and writing reports to facilitate research decision-making.
Ability to program in SQL using MS-SQL or MySQL, ability to developing SQL from a query and reporting standpoint.
Solid statistical programming skills using programs like R, SAS, MySQL.
Assignments related to this position may require modification of standard data analysis practices, and the development of new approaches, methods or techniques for specific applications.
Working knowledge of statistical analysis or data analysis.
Excellent attention to detail, logic, and organizational skills.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.
Experience in genetic or genomic data analysis/management a plus.
Understanding of the healthcare domain, clinical, and epidemiologic data is a plus.







About BVARI




Founded in 1990, BVARI is one of Boston's only small non-profits in biomedical research. We are a strategic partner to the VA Boston Healthcare System, which maintains academic affiliations with several prestigious universities in Boston. We enable top-notch research programs, driving major advances in a number of high-priority disease areas affecting the US veteran population and translating to the general public. Our small business setting is ideal for highly intelligent and driven leaders wishing to make a big impact in the workplace. Every role at BVARI is essential to driving excellence, and every individual is highly valued and challenged to grow and thrive within our environment. We encourage shining stars who wish to push traditional corporate boundaries, deeply broaden their knowledge base, and influence outcomes to apply.




Please note we are unable to provide work authorization and/or visa sponsorship.




The employee must be a resident of Massachusetts upon start date




Work Environment

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.




Selected Service

If you are male application born after December 31, 1959, you must certify that you have registered with the Selective Service System or are exempt from having to do so under the Selective Service Law.




Physical Demands

The physical demands described in this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.




While performing the duties of this job, the employee frequently is required to stand; walk; use hands; and reach with hands and arms.




This position requires the ability to occasionally lift office products and supplies, up to 20 pounds.




Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position, and hours of work and days are Monday through Friday, 8:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.




Travel

No travel is expected for this position.




Work Authorization/Security Clearance

An employee in this position must complete all appropriate background checks at the time of hire and periodic reappointment.




Other Duties

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.




Equal Opportunity Employer

Boston VA Research Institute provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absences, compensation, and training.

HTML:
Data Analyst/Manager


BVARI seeks a Data Analyst/Manager to develop, organize, and analyze data resources and systems for a study at the VA Boston Healthcare System focusing on the genetics of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias, and to optimize the detection of individuals who have been diagnosed with dementia from data in the electronic medical records. The position will be part of a research group consisting of biomedical researchers, clinicians, epidemiologists, biostatisticians, data analysts/programmers, project coordinators, and informatics team with academic affiliations to Boston University. Candidates should have a service-oriented mentality, high sense of ownership of the assigned tasks and ability to solve problems presented by data.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Reporting to the Principal Investigator, the Data Analyst will work closely with statistical programmers, and biostatisticians to identify patient cohorts required for analysis, ensure analysis results are delivered in a timely manner and meet quality standards. Specifically, the Data Manager will be responsible for:

  • Preparing datasets for analyses and gather study data requirements, pull all necessary data, and perform data cleaning, and aggregation/synthesis as appropriate.
  • Assist with performing quality control and identify process improvements.
  • Work with data management team and other data analysts/programmers to design, create and deliver analytical databases, reports, and analyses.
  • Perform validation of programs and databases to fulfill specifications and ensure integrity of outcomes.
  • Develop standard and custom research reports (SQL-SSRS) to meet the needs of the program.
  • Serve as the program expert on EHR requirements, data structure of OMOP records, data quality, and system architecture.
  • Aid in manuscript preparation, report development, and presentations.
  • Establish and maintain communication with fellow teammates to keep them updated on the status of their requests.
  • Ability to manage time across multiple research projects.
  • Ability to work both independently and within a team.


Qualifications

  • Master’s degree, preferably in public health domain, statistics, biostatistics, or computer science with relevant skills, or other science degree with ≥ 2 years of data management or analysis experience
  • Experience in working with big data and capable of working independently in preparing datasets, writing analytic plans, performing analyses and writing reports to facilitate research decision-making.
  • Ability to program in SQL using MS-SQL or MySQL, ability to developing SQL from a query and reporting standpoint.
  • Solid statistical programming skills using programs like R, SAS, MySQL.
  • Assignments related to this position may require modification of standard data analysis practices, and the development of new approaches, methods or techniques for specific applications.
  • Working knowledge of statistical analysis or data analysis.
  • Excellent attention to detail, logic, and organizational skills.
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written.
  • Experience in genetic or genomic data analysis/management a plus.
  • Understanding of the healthcare domain, clinical, and epidemiologic data is a plus.



About BVARI


Founded in 1990, BVARI is one of Boston's only small non-profits in biomedical research. We are a strategic partner to the VA Boston Healthcare System, which maintains academic affiliations with several prestigious universities in Boston. We enable top-notch research programs, driving major advances in a number of high-priority disease areas affecting the US veteran population and translating to the general public. We encourage shining stars who wish to push traditional corporate boundaries, deeply broaden their knowledge base, and influence outcomes to apply.

This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.

Title: Analyst, Data & Analysis
Description:
Digitas is the Networked Experience Agency, built on the vision that we create magnetic experiences that earn the right for brands to exist in human networks. Today, and tomorrow. We deliver Networked Experiences by leveraging comprehensive data, technology, creative, media and strategy capabilities. Digitas delivers ambitious outcomes via unique solutions that include Creative Experiences, Integrated Media, Addressable Relationships, Social Marketing and Total Commerce. Celebrated by Ad Age as Data and Insights Agency of the Year, U.S Campaign’s Brand Experience Agency of the Year, Media Network of the Year and celebrated by Forrester and Gartner, Digitas serves the world’s leading brands through a global network comprised of more than 5,500 employees across over 65 offices in 43 countries.



Job Description



Analyst – Data & Analysis

The Data & Analysis team uses data-driven insights to fuel strategic growth for clients. We believe that data should never exist in a vacuum; instead, it should be put to work to bring the best ideas and stories to our clients

To help with this, we’re looking for an outstanding Analyst – someone who has a knack for understanding data and telling the story of why it matters. You’ll learn from the best in the business as you work with the team to bring actionable insights to our clients. Up for it? Read on.

Job Description:

As an Analyst, you’ll lay the groundwork and contribute to day-to-day reporting needs for client marketing efforts. You’ll work on brand campaigns, acquisition campaigns, site optimization, and/or online testing strategy.

Day-to-day, your role includes:

Keeping a pulse on day-to-day performance data, including display media, site, search, email, and/or social campaigns
Working in a variety of reporting systems and databases for the creation of recurring reports and dashboards
Identifying nuances in data to optimize our clients’ business
Supporting marketing initiatives across project and campaign lifecycles, including measurement plans, primary and secondary research, and performance reporting
Expanding industry knowledge and relevant skillsets through internal training


Qualifications



We’re looking for strong, impactful work experience, which typically includes:

1-3 years of work experience in a relevant industry
A four-year college degree
Passion for digital marketing, eagerness to learn in a constantly-changing space, and a natural curiosity
Familiarity with Excel and/or other data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau a plus
Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment

Got what it takes? We’d love to hear from you.



Additional Information



Digitas is an equal opportunity employer.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DataAnnotation is committed to creating quality AI. Join our team to help train AI chatbots while gaining the flexibility of remote work and choosing your own schedule.




We are looking for a proficient Data Analyst to join our team to train our AI chatbots. You will work with the chatbots that we are building in order to measure their progress, as well as write and evaluate code.




To apply to this role, you will need to be proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript. Your role will require proficiency in at least one programming language (JavaScript, Python, C#, C++, HTML, SQL, or Swift) in order to solve coding problems (think LeetCode, HackerRank, etc). For each coding problem, you must be able to explain how your solution solves the problem.




Benefits:




This is a full-time or part-time REMOTE position
You’ll be able to choose which projects you want to work on
You can work on your own schedule
Projects are paid hourly, starting at $40+ USD per hour, with bonuses for high-quality and high-volume work




Responsibilities:




Come up with diverse problems and solutions for a coding chatbot
Write high-quality answers and code snippets
Evaluate code quality produced by AI models for correctness and performance




Qualifications:




Fluency in English (native or bilingual level)
Proficient in either Python and/or JavaScript
Excellent writing and grammar skills
A bachelor's degree (completed or in progress)
Previous experience as a Software Developer, Coder, Software Engineer, or Programmer




Note: Payment is made via PayPal. We will never ask for any money from you. PayPal will handle any currency conversions from USD. This job is only available to those in the US, UK, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand. Those located outside of these countries will not see work or assessments available on our site at this time.

Show more

Title: Technical Data Analyst
Description:
Technical Data Analyst




KBR, in support of the Volpe Center’s Mission IT Support (MITS) Services program, has several openings to support new FMCSA work. We are seeking a Technical Data Analyst that demonstrates experience in the analysis of user needs and the development of functional and non-functional requirements for web-based applications for the US Department of Transportation (DOT). Candidate must be able to obtain Public Trust Clearance. This position requires an individual to have resided in the United States for 3 out of the last 5 years.




Essential Job function

Evaluates, tests, monitors, and maintains information security policies, procedures and systems such as hardware, firmware, and software.
Ensures security design, controls, and procedures are aligned with information security standards and are appropriate to mitigate risk of exposure.
Identifies security violations, determines cause, and implements procedures to prevent future incidents.
Works under general supervision, and occasional direct supervision, performs assignments requiring experience and knowledge of standard concepts within their field.
Displays core job competencies by analyzing possible solutions using standard procedures while developing advanced skills.
Skills required for this job are typically acquired through the completion of an undergraduate degree and 3+ years of experience, or equivalent work experience in lieu of degree.




Basic Qualifications

This position requires United States residency for three of the last five years.
Must be able to be cleared for a position of Public Trust through the Department of Transportation.
Bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems, or related field preferred 5+ years of related experience.
Understanding of customer mission, strategic goals.
Experience working with business processes and re-engineering.
Experience working with various functional groups within an organization.
Experience with structured analysis techniques; analysis and design of transportation system applications for various architectures (simple to complex); system application prototyping; operating systems and hardware interfaces; database structures, location, and data elements; and/or system benchmarking and performance evaluation.
3+ years of experience working directly with project sponsors and end users.
Good communicator and adept at presenting




Other Qualifications

Strong interpersonal skills to interact with stakeholders: sponsors, customers, end users, and trainers, as well as project technical staff.
Superior writing skills.
Seasoned project management professional, with experience managing both plan driven and change driven project methods.
Experience with the full suite of MS Office tools, including Microsoft Visio.
Experience with development support tools, such as MS Project, Team Foundation Server, Jira, and SharePoint.
Experience using one or more of the following prototyping tools: Axure RP, Microsoft Paint, Microsoft Visio, etc.







KBR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, national origin, veteran status, genetic information, union status and/or beliefs, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Title: Consumer Insights Analyst
Description:
Grow at Welch's!

Welch's is on a journey towards our bold ambition of being the global-leader of convenient, good for you fruit-based food and beverages. To turn this goal into a reality we need you and other exceptionally talented, agile, and innovative individuals who are eager to contribute to something extraordinary!

At Welch's, we're not just offering a job; we're inviting you to be a part of a vibrant, authentic, and inclusive culture where you not only belong, but also have the opportunity to unleash the best, most authentic version of you.

Position Summary

We are seeking a dynamic Insights professional to join our team as a Consumer Insights Analyst. You will play a crucial role in supporting the development and execution of brand strategies to drive business growth.

The Consumer Insights Analyst will join the Welch's marketing team on the journey to refresh and revitalize a 150-year old Brand with a strong equity and purpose. In 2023, we launched a new master brand campaign called Let's Fruit Stuff Up, new package design, and built a disruptive innovation funnel. We need your help to take the next step in making Welch's a modern and relevant brand for today's consumer.

Where You'll Work

This role will initially be based out of our Concord, MA headquarters and then moving to a new space in Waltham MA in the summer of 2025 where you can immerse yourself in a dynamic workplace where innovation thrives and collaboration is key.

Our company in-office schedule is designed to maximize collaboration & relationship building balanced with flexibility and well-being with 3 days in office and Thursdays/Friday being remote, flex days.

What You'll Do


Enrich the organization's knowledge of the consumer, identify category and consumer trends and mine for opportunities
Work with existing primary research (qualitative and quantitative), secondary and syndicated data sources to answer pressing business questions
Own and support projects with key stakeholders and external partners to design studies, manage execution, analyze data and drive insights to guide marketplace solutions
Focus will be on innovation with test and learn approaches and also on identifying opportunities and threats to the business
Simplify complex methods and data to get to the point with actionable recommendations through storytelling
You will roll up your sleeves to get the job done with speed, accuracy and knowledge of cutting edge research techniques


Who You Are


Curious and knowledgeable on how consumers make decisions, especially for new products
Keeps an eye on new trends and are willing to try something new
Problem Solver with analytical capability and creativity
Understands the needs of the customer and consumer by using technology, data and insights
Focus on anticipating and overcoming obstacles with the desire to deliver results
Sets stretch goals and plans to achieve them
Develops meaningful relationships and collaborates across departments
Consistently questions the way things have always been done and challenge courageously for improved methodologies


What You'll Need


Bachelor's Degree in related fields such as psychology, marketing, anthropology, statistics and an MBA preferred. An equivalent combination of education and experience that proves ability to perform role may be considered.
1+ year of related Consumer Insights experience
Food and Beverage or Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) experience is a plus
A foundational knowledge of the Consumer Insights industry with what partners have to offer, especially quick turn solutions
Ability to synthesize data from different sources such as primary, secondary and syndicated and turn into insights
Knowledge in areas such as quantitative and qualitative techniques, new product development, measuring success in market and how to track progress.
Strong ability to simply and clearly communicate about insights with passion, understanding and candor.


At Welch's we value diversity, a passion for what you do, and a commitment to continuous learning. Even if you do not feel you meet every requirement listed, but this role aligns with your strengths and goals we encourage you to apply. Join us and contribute to something extraordinary.

Welch's is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We recognize the importance of diversity in hiring and building a dynamic, strong workforce. We are committed to the prevention of employment discrimination based on race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, national origin, age, marital status, disability and/or military or veteran status, sexual orientation or any other action covered by federal or applicable state/local laws.

What You'll Enjoy


Organization with a bold, clear purpose & vision for the future
Inclusive Culture: Be a part of an inclusive workplace where you not only belong but also have the opportunity to be the best version of yourself
Passionate Community: You are encouraged to have a voice, share your opinions, and have individual impact on the success of the business
Hybrid work model: Flexible & collaborative work environment to maximize well-being & success
Paid Time Off and Holidays: Available immediately for you to enjoy time away from the office to rest and recharge
Paid Volunteer Time Off: 40 hours of paid volunteer time for all non-union employees
Development & Advancement: Formal and informal opportunities to develop and grow your career
Compensation Package Consisting of Competitive Base Salary and Annual Incentive Plan (Bonus)
401K plan with Generous Company Match
Flexible Benefits from your first day: Choose the benefits that meet your needs and preferences
Health, Dental & Vision Insurance
Health Savings Accounts
Life and accident insurance
Employee Assistance Programs
Tuition reimbursement program
Additional benefits available through Perks at Work
Paid parental (and adoption) leave - Available after 12 months of employment

Welch's offers more than just a job - it's an opportunity to grow, innovate, and make a global impact with a passionate community.
Show more

Title: Talent Data Analyst
Description:
Are you ready to build America’s clean energy future with the team that will deliver? Form Energy is an American energy technology and manufacturing company. We are pioneering a new class of iron-air batteries to enable our electric grid to run on renewable, reliable, and affordable energy, every day of the year.

Form Energy has been recognized by TIME as “One of the Best Inventions of 2023” for its battery technology and by MIT Technology Review as a “Top Climate Tech Company to Watch”. We are making rapid progress on our mission of delivering energy storage for a better world, and are growing just as rapidly to meet demand. Our team has more than doubled in size in the past year, and continues to expand every day. We have signed contracts with leading electric utilities across the United States. Pilot production of our iron-air batteries has already begun, and later this year, production will take off to high volumes at our new factory in West Virginia.

Working for Form Energy is more than just a job, it’s a chance to be part of something extraordinary. And right now might be the most exciting moment in the company’s history to join. We are assembling a team of some of the most talented and motivated individuals across the country. Driven by our core values of humanity, excellence, and creativity, our team is determined to deliver on our mission and transform the energy landscape for the better.

Feeling energized to make a meaningful impact on the world? Then keep reading - you’ve come to the right place.

Role Description

Form Energy's talent function is a strategic partner to the business, implementing workforce strategies that attract, deploy & retain diverse and skilled talent. We are seeking a dynamic and analytical HR Data Analyst to join our Human Resources team. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in transforming our talent acquisition, talent management, and other people-related functions through insightful data analytics, storytelling, and the development of robust data dashboards. This role requires a unique blend of data expertise, business acumen, and the ability to translate complex data into compelling narratives that drive actionable insights.

Applicants must be in the eastern timezone with access to a Form Energy location.

What You'll Do


Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets related to talent acquisition, talent management, employee engagement, performance, and other HR metrics.
Identify key trends, patterns, and insights to support strategic decision-making.
Perform predictive analytics to anticipate future trends and provide actionable recommendations.
Develop and maintain interactive data dashboards that provide real-time insights and reporting for HR and business leaders.
Create compelling data-driven stories that communicate insights and recommendations effectively to non-technical stakeholders.
Implement data governance best practices to ensure high-quality and reliable data.
Partner with HR leaders and business units to understand their needs and provide customized analytical solutions.
Work closely with talent acquisition, talent management, and other HR teams to support their analytics needs.
Train and support HR team members in using data tools and interpreting analytics.
Support the optimization of Ashby ATS & Analytics platform.
Support and analyze the impact of various talent programs and initiatives.


What You'll Bring


Bachelor's degree with 3+ years of people analytics experience with experience in applicant tracking systems, HRIS tools and other people database technologies
Advanced excel skills and experience with data visualization tools (i.e. Tableau, Power BI, etc.);
Strong attention to detail to ensure data integrity and data governance and accuracy
Analytical and problem-solving skills to draw appropriate conclusions from data
Strong verbal communication skills in order to explain and present data visually in a clear, compelling manner.
Proven ability to handle highly confidential and sensitive information in a discreet manner
Ability to work collaboratively in a dynamic environment


Applications will be accepted until the job is filled.

Humanity is a cornerstone of Form Energy’s culture, and we make sure our compensation and benefits reflect that. Form Energy offers competitive salaries, stock options, and a holistic benefits package to ensure all employees have what they need to thrive while working here.

When it comes to you and your family’s health, we cover 100% of medical, dental, and vision premiums for full-time employees - and 80% of healthcare premiums for dependents. This starts from day one. We also offer at least 12 weeks of paid leave for new parents (up to 20 weeks for birthing parents), and generous vacation policies to give employees time to recharge when needed.

To build a clean and equitable energy future, we need everyone at the table. We strive to form a team as diverse as the communities we will serve with our technology, and are committed to maintaining an inclusive environment for all employees. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply to our open jobs.


Show more

Title: Provider Data Analyst / Healthcare Data Analyst
Description:
Direct Hire/ Permanent Opening




Provide Data Analyst / Healthcare Data Analyst




Location - Hybrid required at Assembly Row

-Flexible hybrid schedule, 2-3 times a week. Tuesdays / another day depending on need

Salary – 105-110 K

Covid Vaccinations and Flu required




Hospital in Boston, MA is looking to add a Provider / MDM Analyst.

Ideally this resource will have experience working with an MDM tool (Profisee, Informatica, Infosphere) in a healthcare environment - dealing with Provider data.




Client will also look at a more junior resource that has experience as a Healthcare Data Analyst doing Credentialing.




From Client:

• Preferred – Provider MDM experience highly preferred. - Or someone who did credentialling/ hospital systems, getting into the data. We could train on the MDM tool next need if they have tangential experience with providers / understands claims, informatics, Tableau, Power BI, understanding data systems.

MDM is aggregating data from multiple systems and setting the right governance and processes/ logic would be a nice to have.

Title: Entry-Level Management Trainee - Data Analysis & Growth Strategies
Description:
Description

Are you ready to launch your career in management with a dynamic team? We're looking for a motivated and enthusiastic individual for a full-time, remote Entry-Level Management position. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to dive into various tasks, including data analysis, growth strategies, project management, and team communication. You’ll also engage in sales activities, helping us drive success and growth.

Responsibilities


Analyze data to support decision-making and strategy development.
Implement innovative growth strategies to drive success.
Manage projects from start to finish, ensuring timely and effective completion.
Communicate and collaborate with team members to achieve shared goals.
Participate in sales activities and contribute to our growth objectives.


Skills


Strong analytical skills and experience in project management.
Excellent communication abilities, both written and verbal.
A background in growth hacking and sales is highly desirable.
Previous experience in the insurance industry is a plus, but not required.


If you're passionate about making a positive impact and growing in a supportive environment, we'd love to hear from you!

Employment Type: Full-Time

Title: Ethics & Compliance Data Analyst
Description:
We are working with a Fortune 500 Energy Company seeking an Ethics & Compliance Data Analyst. The Ethics & Compliance Data Analyst plays a crucial role at the intersection of law, data analysis, and communications. The role supports the company’s Ethics & Compliance team by providing data-derived insights, managing communication strategies, and ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. The analyst will help streamline processes, enhance decision making, and improve overall efficiency. Annual Salary is expected to be circa $110,000. The company offers a comprehensive benefits package, further details of which the company will supply.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES




Data Analysis and Reporting

Collect, organize, and analyze data from various sources.
Develop and maintain databases and data management systems.
Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Investigate and integrate data from disparate and varied data sources.
Conduct research to benchmark industry best practices.
Prepare regular reports, dashboards, and presentations to various stakeholders, summarizing compliance statistics, key findings, and recommendations.
Analyze data and conduct reviews to provide insights for risk mitigation.




Communication Management & Training

Coordinate and manage communication strategies for Ethics & Compliance matters based upon insights gained through data analysis and testing.
Communicate complex results and concepts to non-technical audiences.
Design and deliver targeted training programs to educate employees about compliance requirements and ethical behavior, based on information obtained.




Project Management

Support Ethics & Compliance projects by managing timelines, resources, and deliverables.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the smooth execution of Ethics & Compliance initiatives.
Track and report on project progress, identifying and addressing any issues.
Develop processes and tools that test, monitor, analyze, and continuously improve compliance programs.




Process Development and Optimization

Design and implement scalable processes for monitoring and enforcing compliance requirements.
Streamline existing processes to improve efficiency and effectiveness.




Additional Duties

Support ethics and compliance programs related to data analysis, risk assessments, dashboard development, and surveys.
Develop and execute testing strategies to assess the effectiveness of compliance programs.
Analyze testing results to identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement.




SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor's degree in Law, Data Science, Communications, or a related field
Strong analytical skills with experience in data analysis, as well as interpretation skills geared toward recognizing and interpreting data-driven insights
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Familiarity with legal terminology and processes
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., PowerBI, Excel, SQL, Python)
Legal tech software/ experience with languages used to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously
Attention to detail and strong organizational skills
A curious mindset for continuous learning and improvement and the ability to break down large problems into smaller parts for simpler solutions




OTHER DETAILS

Location: Onsite
Salary: Circa $110,000
Benefits: Full Package with detail to be supplied by company




Candidates may apply to this position on LinkedIn, on the Hire Counsel website, or by direct e-mail to dadler@hirecounsel.com. We at Hire Counsel cannot promise that a particular candidate will get the job or an interview, but we can promise that we will review all submitted resumes.




About Hire Counsel




Hire Counsel is an agile legal talent agency. We build connections between legal professionals and our clients, some of the nation's largest law firms and legal departments (and some of the smallest). By connecting good lawyers with our clients, we help attorneys find a permanent home. We also provide individuals with the option to work on contract (temporary) assignments to aid their stability as they proceed with their job searches. Hire Counsel holds all resumes in the strictest confidence.

Title: Real Estate Data Analyst (Portfolio Opportunity)
Description:
An early-stage company, at the forefront of providing AI-based solutions for the real estate industry, is seeking a Real Estate Data Analyst. Their mission is to empower real estate professionals to increase revenue or reduce costs by unlocking the benefits of AI through aggregating unstructured data, integrating data into existing reporting systems, and analyzing the information into actionable insights. This role is an amazing opportunity to work directly with customers while utilizing your technical skillset. As an early employee, you'll be able to directly impact the growth of the company and grow professionally.




The ideal candidate will have proficiency in SQL and experience running queries and performing analytics and reporting, with a focus on interacting directly with customers. While knowledge of the commercial real estate field is preferred, it is not required. The responsibilities of this role include:




Data Analysis and Reporting:

Perform data analysis to support analytics, reporting, and insights on client data and prospective clients.
Execute queries to extract, cleanse, and analyze data from various sources.
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to visualize key metrics and trends.
Incorporate real estate data into industry-specific financial performance metrics and execute analysis into custom dashboard reporting.

Clients and Sales:

Assess market trends, aggregate third-party data, and integrate this information with clients’ real estate data (as well as company KPI’s) to unlock value and support strategic decision-making.
Assist with sales, marketing, and business development as requested by managers.

Collaboration and Communication:

Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand data needs, reporting, and provide actionable insights.
Communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders clearly and concisely.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree, preferably in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in Excel/ Google spreadsheets
Proficiency in SQL, Python, and/or additional programming languages, with experience in running complex queries.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and draw actionable insights.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
Knowledge of real estate industry data and trends is preferred
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.




The anticipated salary for this role is between $60,000 and $80,000 per year, depending on candidate experience (and not including benefits, equity, etc.)

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Integrity Lab creates intelligent technology to foster integrity within the world’s leading organizations. Our data-driven advisory team analytically investigates the most pressing integrity challenges facing organizations, including fraud, bribery, and harassment. We employ cutting-edge approaches to proactively mitigate misconduct.




Our Cambridge-based team, led by a Harvard Business School Professor, has diverse expertise in data science, statistics, econometrics, engineering, and software design. We routinely support organizations facing significant public and regulatory scrutiny.




We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our innovative and dynamic team. In this role, you will partner with industry-leading US multinationals to solve their critical compliance analytics needs. You will have the opportunity to work with rich, proprietary datasets to generate actionable managerial insights. You will communicate complex data insights through visualizations, reports, and presentations to senior stakeholders at our clients. You will further contribute to groundbreaking internal research projects to shape the future of compliance analytics.




This role would be especially well suited for a candidate who wants to pursue a graduate degree in a quantitative social science field.




What you’ll do

Draw inferences about behavior and organizational culture using various data techniques
Independently manage a diverse range of datasets, including conducting preliminary and exploratory analysis, merging datasets, and creating clear documentation.
Develop and present clear, concise visualizations to showcase findings
Communicate findings to internal and external stakeholders, including C-Suite leaders, through memos and presentations.
Collaborate on innovative R&D projects to shape the future of compliance and organizational culture analytics




What we’re looking for from you

An exceptional academic record with a bachelor's in Economics, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
2-4 years of experience in quantitative data analysis, preferably within a consulting or tech environment.
Proficiency in Python for data analysis and modeling.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data and provide actionable insights.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to present data findings clearly and concisely.
Self-starter comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment.




Some nice to-haves

Knowledge of Stata is highly desirable.
Experience in consulting, particularly in projects related to organizational culture or compliance.




What we offer

Competitive compensation package
A collaborative environment with a kind, dedicated, friendly team
The opportunity to engage in meaningful work that tackles significant integrity challenges facing organizations today
Opportunities for professional development, training, and career progression.
Paid time off
Health, vision, and dental insurance
401k plan




We value diverse viewpoints, and we do not discriminate based on one’s race, creed, national origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, handicap, disability, veteran status, or military obligations.

Show more

Title: Data Visualization Analyst (PowerBI Developer) - No C2C/No Sponsorship
Description:
Job Title: Digital Data and Visualization Analyst (PowerBI Developer)

Location: Hybrid - Framingham, MA

Terms: 6+ month contract




We are re-imagining the experience with a new platform and look for you to make an impact. If you are looking for a contract in analytics that allows you to sharpen your data management and visualization expertise and help teams make impactful decisions, apply now!




Key responsibilities of the role:

End-to-end PowerBI dashboard development for key ecommerce business use cases to enable real-time insights for business owners.
Perform analysis in BigQuery to sharpen our data infrastructure and craft unique business cases on consumer behavior.
Leverage best in class practices around ETL pipeline creation including staging, integration, and job models in DBT and Snowflake.
Establish strong QA process’ to ensure ongoing data accuracy.




Skills and Experience:

4+ years of data visualization experience
Experience working with BigQuery and Google Analytics 4 is a plus
Advanced knowledge of data visualization techniques in PowerBI and PowerQuery.
Experience in the creation and maintenance of ETL pipelines.
Expert in SQL and knowledge/use of other programming languages such as Python
Ability to translate business use cases into data outputs and visualizations.
Proven track record of establishing best in class QA data process’.

  • Proven track record of establishing best in class QA data process’.

Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail with a demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects, prioritize requests, and meet deadlines

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Hi Marley is the first intelligent conversational platform built for P&C insurance and powered by SMS. Designed by insurance professionals, Hi Marley enables lovable, convenient conversations across the entire ecosystem, saving money and time for carriers while building customer loyalty through delightful interactions. Hi Marley's industry-leading collaboration, coaching and analytics capabilities deliver crucial insights that streamline carrier operations while enabling a frictionless customer engagement experience. The solution is made for the enterprise; it's fast to deploy, easy to use and seamlessly integrates with core insurance systems. Through its advanced conversational technology, Hi Marley reduces friction – empowering innovative carriers to reinvent the customer and employee experience.

We're on a mission to redefine data-driven insights in the insurance industry. We're looking for a talented Senior Data Analyst to be a key player in our growing data and analytics team. In this role, you'll help shape our data landscape by contributing to the creation of an innovative and cutting-edge data enterprise solution. You'll work closely with our product, finance, and customer teams to turn data into actionable insights, manage the transformation layer, and refine our data pipelines. Reporting to the Manager of Analytics, you'll collaborate with various business stakeholders to prioritize and drive impactful projects. We thrive on teamwork and shared enthusiasm, which is why this role involves joining us in the office for two days each week.

We are a small but impactful team, wearing many hats. If you're passionate, curious, and want to roll up your sleeves to drive business success, we'd love to hear from you!

What You'll Do: 


Collaborate with stakeholders to define business problems and drive data-informed decision-making with proactive and thorough analysis
Optimize and maintain the data pipeline, developing clean, logical data models that enable self-service analytics and increase speed to insights
Create high-quality visualizations to support internal and external stakeholders, narrating data stories and advancing product initiatives
Maintain comprehensive data documentation and troubleshoot any discrepancies
Work with product and engineering teams to define and refine data requirements


What We're Looking For: 


Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering or Analytics
4+ years of experience in a Data Analyst role with hands-on experience working on an ELT or semantic layer
Proficiency in SQL, LookML, Excel, and at least one statistical programming language (e.g., R or Python)
Experience with Looker or similar data visualization tools
Ability to simplify complex problems into actionable analytical frameworks
Strong autonomy with a commitment to delivering high-quality work
Solid understanding of database and data warehousing concepts, with exposure to tools like dbt.


Who We Are:

Hi Marley has three core values that are the foundation of our company culture, which every employee embodies:


Max Courage - we encourage our team, our customers, and their customers to dream big, try new ideas and maximize impact by measuring risk.
Be Humble – we lead with appreciation and promote a culture of humility, compassion and openness to learn from anyone, anywhere.
Ubuntu "I am because we are" - we believe true success is much bigger than any single individual or company. By aligning our individual aims behind a shared purpose we can achieve our fullest potential, together.


Benefits and Perks:

On top of an exciting, supportive and intellectually curious workplace, we provide:


Full benefits package for employees working 30+ hours per week, including parental leave, a matching 401k program, and medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance.
Open vacation policy - we all work hard and take time for ourselves when we need it
Competitive salary and generous stock options - we all get to own a piece of what we're building
A fun, lively startup culture
Core values-based leadership
A culture of employee engagement, diversity and inclusion
Ample opportunities to learn and take on new responsibilities in a fast-paced, growth-mode startup


Hi Marley is proud to be an equal employment opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and do not discriminate based on gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, race, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. We are committed to building an inclusive work environment representing a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills, where all employees are encouraged to be their authentic selves.

Hi Marley participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. For more information, please review the documents under "E-Verify Poster" here: https://e-verify.uscis.gov/web/OnlineResources.aspx
Show more
